Reviews.Title: “IT WAS AN AMAZING OVERNIGHT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: THERESA D
Reviews.Content: It was an amazing overnight visit. The entire staff was so professional and at the same time pleasant and caring. The Hotel was so clean and beautiful We enjoyed the entire experience of staying in a hotel that was near the Harbor and Camden Yards where we were able to enjoy a great Yankee/Baltimore game. We hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: TheSurvivorFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice hotel with extremely nice employees. The food was great and the atmosphere was very cool. All the dishes are inspired by other cuisines aeound the world. I found it very cool and I would love to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, view of the inner harbor. Top notch service”
Reviews.Author: Oski80
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed visiting Baltimore, and this hotel and the staff made it easy and fun. (Baltimore is a very easy city to visit. Candidly, we were surprised at how nice every thing has been made for tourists.) The gym was really good for a hotel gym. We walked everywhere, and the staff's suggestions of places to walk to and restaurants was quite welcome. Our dinner was very good as was our breakfast, and once again the service was quite professional. Our room looking over the Inner Harbor was quite fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarylandLuvVacations
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental for 3 days for my daughter's spring break. Although we live only 45 minutes from Baltimore, we hadn't been to Baltimore in 3 years. Given the wide array of things to do for children, we decided to do a local spring break. What a treat --- both the Harbour area and the Hotel. The Hotel is very pretty, lobby has beautiful fresh flowers, and the service is exceptional. The front desk has the most pleasant front desk staff I've encountered. They are more than accomodating. We visited Rusty Scuppers for dinner (recomment a visit...food was good and great harbour views) and while you can see if from the hotel, they suggested that given it was 6:45pm, we had a young child, temps dropped to about 45 degrees that while we could walk, we should consider taking the shuttle. They called Rusty Scuppers and they had a shuttle to the hotel in less than 10 minutes. We didn't plan to be in the room much, so we just opted for a regular courtyard view which served us well. The rooms are incredibly spacious and while the furniture isn't new, it isn't old and disgusting either!! Everything was clean and comfortable. My 5-year old especially liked the TV in the bathroom -- suggesting that we should have that at home. Our room safe was broken and they sent someone up immediately to fix it. We didn't have sufficient towels and someone was up in 5 minutes to bring new ones. The in-room coffee makers were Keurig's with a great assortment of coffees and teas. As with most hotels, the bottled water in the room was expensive, but I expect that. So, we bring our own Fuji water and don't even bother with it. My husband visited the Explorer's Lounge and said it was great. The pool is very small and is 5 and 1/2 feet throughout the entire pool, but it was fine for us. They also have a nice gym. It's small, but packed with equipment. Their gym areas also has a racquetball court and a studio for yoga or pilates. The only negative part of our experience, which the hotel compensated us for was the Brighton's Restaurant. They seem not to be able to accomodate a crowd. The first day it took us 40 minutes to get our breakfast, the second day almost an hour, and the thir day, we gave up. It was frustrating and many of the tables around us experienced the same thing. We had a breakfast credit built into our rate, so maybe that was the problem. They didn't expect so many people to have bought that particular package...not sure, but it was not idea. It was so bad on day two that they credited our account $100 for the two days of poor service we had on the breakfast dining. What a great thing to do!!! I highly recommend the InterContinental Harbor Court in Baltimore. Also recommend, going to Miss Shirley for breakfast or lunch (only open til 3). Oh my...delicious!!!! It's about a 10 minute walk from the hotel --somewhat accross the street from the Acquarium!!!

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service from the concierge and food service - nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ecnewyork60763
Reviews.Content: we spent a weekend in Baltimore with a group and had excellent help from the concierge, robert in planning restaurant reservations, transportation and any last minute detail. robin in the food services department was most accommodating as well. The rooms were clean with nice marble baths. Some of the rooms had great views of the harbor. all in all, I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: lvshack
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the InterContinental Harbor hotel Easter weekend. Our plans were to relax and attend a game at Camden Yards. Check in time was 3 p.m., however when we arrived at 5, we were informed that our room would not be available for several more hours. This was very disappointing, as we had plans at 6, and needed our room immediately. We had to downgrade our room in order to get a room immediately. We were not very happy. The room was very basic - I don't know how long it has been since the hotel has been updated, but in my opinion it is in need of one now. All of the furniture had clearly seen better days, with chips, scratches and overall wear and tear. The carpet had several areas of spots, and there were several dust and dirt piles in the corners of the room. The bathrooms may have been renovated in the near past - the tile looked updated but the overall layout seemed odd. The bathroom footprint itself is large, but the location of the tub and toilet were almost touching, making it feel cramped. The room noise was also poor. This room overlooked the courtyard, so there wasn't any street noise - however we were woken very early in the morning by a metallic scraping noise. We were two doors down from the service elevator, so I'm assuming this had something to do with it. If you stay, I'd recommend requesting a room far from this area. We ordered dinner and breakfast room service, which was very quick and the quality average. Although they had lunch and dinner options for kids, there were none for breakfast. The portions were decent and the prices were not too bad. I think the best thing this hotel has going for it is the location. It is right across the street from the Science Center and Inner Harbor walkway, and within a 15 minute walk to Camden Yards. Next time we stay in Baltimore, I think we might try another location for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with comfortable rooms and great views. If you are not an ambassador member of the chain, the movies are 20, wifi is not included and the water is $5. You do get a newspaper in the morning. The lobby is comfortable, but there are no included shuttles or included breakfasts. There is a fitness center and you are walking distance to many downtown attractions and 10 minutes from the train. Rooms are large and the bed is comfortable and food from room service is good. The price of 189 was appropriate for a room like this. There was a robe in the room and toiletries were adequate. As an ambassador member I received free fruit, free water and a free movie and was upgraded to a lovely harbor view. Other rooms appeared to overlook the inner courtyard, Even though I was an ambassador, errors were made on my bill that included wifi and the movie and my reservation was wrong. This was quickly and cheerfully corrected. Room turndown came late one night at 9:30. As

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront Baltimore at its finest”
Reviews.Author: mcdedrick
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight with my teenage daughter while on a college visit. The location right at Inner Harbor is what drew me here, and it was well worth it. We had a lovely, very spacious room facing the harbor. Clean, very nicely appointed with many nice luxurious extras. The only reduced mark I gave this hotel was for sleep quality, for while the bed itself was super plush and soft, the sheets felt scratchy and it made it a bit hard to get comfy. An easy walk to so many different things to do and places to eat. The Baltimore transportation systems are very user friendly, we took the light rail to the hotel from the airport (3.00 one way vs. 30.00 cab fare) and got off at Camden yards, strolled down the hill a couple blocks to the harbor and our hotel. The Explorer's Lounge was a beautiful bar area, where we enjoyed a glass of Champagne and a half dozen oysters on the half shell for $15! It also had a lovely view of the harbor. Will definitely return to this property when back in Baltimore. A beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashion Service”
Reviews.Author: L D
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival in the wee hours, I was greeted by "Mr Baily" He was the valet, the Bellman ect. I had washed my jeans before leaving home but did not have a chance to dry them. When I checked in at the front desk I ask the clerck if there was an on site dryer. He replied the was not. I proceeded to my room and Mr Baily arrived with my luggage. He asked me if I wanted my jeans dryed, I said yes and asked if it was going to be done on site his said yes again. I asked if they would return to my room before 7am, he stated he would personally handle it and return to room. first thing in the am I opened my door and founf my jeans dry hung on hangers in plastic. He did not charge me or wait for a tip. Good ole fashion service, Hats off to Mr Baily

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and service during conference”
Reviews.Author: TheShank
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference held at this hotel (for the 2nd time) and found it to be a very warm and relaxing environment. The staff were extremely professional and their service was exemplary. The food served by the hotel during the conference was much better than the average fare served at events of this nature. Possibly most importantly, I found the bed and bedding to be extremely comfortable and relaxing, and helped provide a restful night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Terri L
Reviews.Content: 2 friends and I just got back from Baltimore for a girls weekend and stayed at the Intercontinental. Our experience was fabulous. Check-in went smooth and quick. We were given room 434 which overlooked a courtyard. We did not upgrade as we did not intend on spending much time in the room. The room was spacious and beautiful. My husband booked the room for us and he is a rewards member. When we got to the room, there was a welcome card along with a chocolate bar and free large bottle of water. We got into the room and immediately made our way over to the harbor for dinner which was directly across the street. Saturday we had breakfast in the coffee shop, the service was pleasant. In fact, all the staff we encountered were amazing. We enjoyed the pool for a few hours which was nice, nothing spectacular but we witnessed one family who ordered drinks from room service who delivered to the pool. After returning from the pool we were getting ready for dinner. We called the concierge who recommended an amazing restaurant. They called us a cab and waited on the street to get it for us, and also offered us umbrellas while we waited. We decided at about 11:30pm to hit up the explorer lounge and Cameron the bartender was fabulous. Wonderful personality and dealt with all of our obscure questions and answered with a smile. At one point we mentioned that one of our beds was slightly lopsided(which we didn't think was a big deal), but Cameron immediately had someone sent to our room to fix it :). Although we honestly spent minimal time at the hotel, we were always greeted with smiling faces and staff willing to help us in any way. I am already thinking about my next trip down there for another girls weekend :)

Reviews.Title: “Revisiting a Scene from our Dreams”
Reviews.Author: j t
Reviews.Content: Sixteen years ago, on March 10, 1996, my husband and I were married at the Harbor Court Hotel. It was an exquisite event, fulfilling all of our expectations (as has our marriage!). We moved to Cleveland right after the wedding. On March 10, 2012, we decided to fly into Baltimore, stay at the Harbor Court (now the Intercontinental Harbor Court), have dinner and fly back home. We are aware of the changes that take place in the world in 16 years, and were not surprised to find many of the landmarks we remembered look different or disappear. The best surprised was that the Harbor Court did NOT change. It remained a first class, beautiful, elegant spot with the same courteous, helpful, and pleasant customer (guest) service. We were treated as thought we "owned" the hotel. The rooms was fabulous, including an unexpected gift of champagne and sweets delivered by the manager. The location of this property is perfect. It's like living in the heart of a wondrous city and being able to walk to everything... drinkgs, snacks, shopping, fine dining, site seeing, strolling. It does not feel like a hotel. It feels like a guest home. We will not wait another 16 years to visit. J and j

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: bosboy76
Reviews.Content: Thank You to the staff for a perfect weekend in Baltimore. This was my first visit to hotel, and to city, enjoyed both! The hotel is clean, staffed by friendly people (Like Jolly who works the front desk), offers first rate service and comfortable beds. Hotel -- Is an old world style Hotel. I am more of a modern style person, but enjoyed being taken back to a different time. Now, don't get me wrong, I am not saying the building or furnishing is dated. I am saying that I enjoyed the old world style and service I don't see often. Big rooms and nice bathrooms. Internet worked well, room service was fast and rooms are clean and comfortable. The location of hotel was perfect. I didn't need a car and walked everyplace. The subway from airport was fast and inexpensive. Federal Hill (an old neighborhood) was 3 blocks away and I enjoyed a nice meal and fun night life. The harbor was across the street with many dinning, shopping and entertainment options. The two nights were filled with activities and events. The city of Baltimore has done a great job of creating a modern and clean area for people to enjoy. So, if you are looking for a nice fun weekend away. I recommend this hotel and this part of Baltimore. I was not disappointed. Thank You to the entire staff for an awesome weekend!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “My group held a complex board meeting and it was flawless.”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: We held a very complex board meeting with multiple rooms simultaneous catering needs and people flying in and out from around the country and everything went off without a hitch. The staff was flawless. Friendly, accommodating and able to deal with last minute requests, the intercontinental Baltimore really sets the standard for excellence in my experience. Our Banquet Captain was named Jeff Hall and his team is extremely well run. Someone should run a study on them as they are a marvel to watch. Even the Bellman, Mr. Coley has 2 Masters Degrees and is a former History teacher. A fountain of knowledge who loves his job and it shows. The catering, the timing, the A/V, the design of the hotel, and the staff all made this a great meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: Jessica A
Reviews.Content: We checked in to find that the cold water was not working in our bathroom. We called down to the front desk and within 20 minutes someone was apologetically in our room working on it. Because of the inconvenience, they sent up a complimentary fruit platter. We then received a follow up call from the front desk assuring everything was satisfactorily fixed. Upon check out, the concierge notified us that the manager wanted to speak to us. He apologized again and was super friendly about it...imagine if we had a legit issue?! Aside from their truly impressive commitment to customer service, the hotel itself is beautiful, well-maintained, in an awesome location, and clean with comfy beds. The staff is friendly and the hotel is not astronomically priced, especially considering its caliber and location. We totally recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: MikeDenzler
Reviews.Content: An wonderful experience from the time we first checked in. The staff at the front desk were some of the nicest and personable I have ever experience at a hotel. My wife, son and I were 2 hours early. It was not a problem. The gentleman helping us check in let us know for a small fee($30). We got upgrade to a Harbor view room. It would have been at least $50 or more through Expedia. The upgrade was well worth it. We had a magnificent view of the Inner Harbor. The hotel is beautiful. The pool and spa area are very nice. The door man was great. When we asked him for a taxi it was there in less than a minute. He even cleaned out the trash from the floor of the cab. When we requested a late check out to allow us to visit a restaurant for breakfast, again not an issue. We were allowed to check out at 2:00 pm just by joining the priority club. No fee. My family will stay at InterContenintal hotels whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our three boys to Baltimore over President’s Day weekend. We received a warm and friendly welcome upon arrival starting with the valet service all the way to the staff at the front desk. Any time we encountered a staff member, they were extremely courteous and helpful in making our stay at the hotel enjoyable. The room was fantastic and we lucked out with a view of the harbor which was incredible. My boys loved using the pool and hot tub (I think that’s where that had most of their fun) and they loved the breakfast sandwiches from the coffee shop located in the lobby of the hotel. The hotel is beautiful and located right in the heart of the Baltimore harbor. It was an easy walk to all the museums, even with the little bit of cold weather we had. I will definitely book my stay at this hotel the next time we spend an overnight in Baltimore. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Grinchfamily
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our kids on a weekend getaway for President's Weekend. From the minute we pulled in until we pulled out a couple days later, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We were greeted by the valet and assisted with our bags and took our car. The staff at the Front Desk were very accomodating and went out of their way to make sure they answered all of our questions, called restaurants for availability and reservations and provided whatever we asked for. The valet/ bellman brought our bags up, made sure we were happy with the room made a list of a few requests that we did have and had housekeeping take care of all of them very quickly. We have 5 children (ages8-14) so we usually need to get adjoining rooms or two rooms that do not connect. We stayed in the King/ Queen Corner Suite overlooking the Harbor and the room was excellent. Very roomy even for 7 people and 3 large beds that allowed for everyone to sleep comfortable and in the same room. The cost was less than getting two regular rooms. My sons and I enjoyed the racquetball court and we all enjoyed the pool. The hotel was very well decorated and extremely well maintained. The housekeeping staff was also very accomodating and very friendly. In addition to a great hotel stay, we strongly recommend the inner Harbor for a weekend getaway with or without the kids. Great food and fun all within walking distance. Make sure to have lunch or dinner at Dick's Last Resort, an absolute hilarious time and the food was as good as you will get for a "themed" restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Jenmac215
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy my visits to the Inner Harbor, and this one was especially nice. My significant other treated me to a weekend getaway at Harbor Court during the Christmas holidays. We found the hotel to be clean and beautifully decorated. The staff was professional and very nice. Thanks Nicole for the complimentary bottle of wine and the lovely, spacious room with fantastic views of the entire harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not as good as other InterContinentals”
Reviews.Author: SOT_II
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of InterContinentals and I've come to know and expect superior service and quality from them. Although the service was outstanding, the hotel itself, and in particular our room, was not to the level I have come to expect from the InterContinental Hotel. These comments are directly related to room 317, a junior suite, and may not reflect the rest of the rooms but I have a feeling it sort of does. 1. The couch and bed were very "worn out" although we slept soundly I think that was more due to the nature of our travels then the quality of the bed. The couch, I don't think I would even keep that couch in my basement let alone a hotel of this caliber. It was so worn out that you sort of sank into it. 2. The carpet was very worn and had very large stains on it. I'm not sure exactly what the stains were from but they were about the size of a person, one right by the TV and one in the middle of the room. The wallpaper was peeling off in various spots around the room. 3. The TV in the living area would randomly either mute or shut off. At first I thought that someone else in a room above might have a like remote but after actually trying to figure it out it seemed that the TV would overheat and then stop working. If it muted you could move a channel up, then back and it would work...the mute/unmute button had no effect. If it shut off no amount of button pressing would turn it back on, you just had to wait. 4. TV in the bathroom is VERY dangerous!!!! The TV in the bathroom is a hazard. It almost hit my son on the head. It is on a stalk mount and the threads on the back of the TV as well as the threads on the stalk adjustment are stripped. If you move it at all the TV flips forward and, in my case almost hit my son in the head. Again I like the InterContinental brand and most of their properties this one is just not up to par. The staff made up for the lack of the room on this stay, that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Darin C
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 small children stayed here a night in FEB2012. The whole experience was amazing. The hotel is beautiful, the staff are absolutely wonderful, and the restaurant was incredible. Not only is the hotel ammenities and staff great, but the proximity to the Harbor and Federal Hill was a plus. This would definitely be my first choice of hotels in Baltimore. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Bwhitlow
Reviews.Content: I have been to a lot of hotels in Baltimore, and I would say this hotel has the nicest rooms! And lots of space. The service was great, the views of the harbor were very nice! I can't wait to bring my wife here for vacation! Thank you for being a great hotel. And this will be my new home when I visit for bussiness or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth059
Reviews.Content: This wasn't my first stay at this hotel but as usual I am always pleased with the surroundings, the service, the pool and the size of the sleeping room. This hotel is as traditional as it gets, the sweeping staircase, the library and my favorite, the Explorer Lounge. The decore of the lounge is that of "Out of Africa" and i picture myself in Karen Blixin's living room each time I go to imbibe. ( I have been to Karen Blixin's house in Nairobi). You can't ask for a more civilized experience. It is one that I have to have at least once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: lucyanne1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 20 minutes from the Amtrak station; easy to find. Excellent location in that it is 1/2 block from the Inner Harbor area which has wonderful attractions. Exceptional and friendly service from everyone: bellman, check-in, room service, housekeeping, bar and restaurant staff. Delicious food both from room service and restaurant. Lovely Explorer Bar. I was acknowleged and thanked for being a Priority Club member and addressed by name. There was free-wi available, too. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Intercontinental Harbor Court Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Brad S
Reviews.Content: A very nice experience.. Chad the manager.. did a great job making our stay a positive experience.. Nice rooms.. way more than expected.. Great views of the Inner Harbor.. Lounge area was so relaxing and classy.. was given a recommendation for Brunch that was a Home Run..(Regi's) Highly recommend! Class for the value!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HRQueen10
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the InterContinental for the first time. It is a magnificent hotel. From check in to check out everything was fabulous. The staff is truly dedicated to the comfort and pleasure of its guests. This hotel is a true jewel on the Baltimore harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTaf
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed overnight - our first stay here at Harbor Court. Front desk staff very efficient, made to feel very welcome. Our Harbor View room was perfect. Slept like a baby. Beautiful view - even in January. Impressed that SERVICE was clearly a PRIORITY here, it was evident, from the parking attendant, to the front desk - to the server at the " Explorers Lounge". My husband & I look forward to staying this Summer. Wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Baltimore in January!”
Reviews.Author: Melimae065
Reviews.Content: There are so many positive things I can say about this hotel, I don't know where to begin. A girlfriend and I went to watch the Texans and Ravens playoff game and chose this hotel because it was directly on the harbor. We stayed in mid January. Our first night there we met up with friends at a local pub and they gave us a complimentary private car ride to the pub. Our phones were stolen @ the pub and they did everything in their power to help us out. The long distance phonecalls were $10 a minute and they cut our phone bill in half. That is a little pricey as well as the almost $45 a day valet parking, but half off the phone bill was better than nothing. They upgraded us to a harbor view, complimentary movie. This may be all because I'm an Ambassador member but it was fantastic. We got fresh fruits and chocolates daily along with the newspaper. We had a fully stocked mini bar with all kinds of goodies. Again the staff, location, friendliness, cleanliness, etc. was just amazing. I would def. stay here again! Thanks Intercontinental Baltimore for a wonderful and rememberable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Complacency”
Reviews.Author: LucianoX-19
Reviews.Content: Poor, smu service at the restaurant and Explorer Lounge. Some staff committed to hospitality, but inconsistant. Cafe servers can be rude. When mentioned, management was unresponsive, put the problem on me, suggesting no other problems with others. Well, I suppose that explains the universally low-satisfaction ratings, thre going out of business. Recommendations: provide your business to anoother more appreciative and profssional, The Four Saesons.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: SciFiGirl007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed overnite and have visited this hotel for dinner and drinks many times.....overall for about 10 years. Most recently, my overnite visits were in Dec 2011 and Jan 2012. Everything about the hotel is top-notch from service, accommodations, and amenities. I've stayed in both courtyard and harbor view rooms. Both are more than adequate; but you cannot beat looking at the sunrise or full moon over the harbor from your hotel window. Its kind of one of those "priceless"moments. The breakfast buffet is offered when hotel occupancy is at a certain level, otherwise a la carte breakfast is your option. The buffet is wonderful! If you are seated for breakfast buffet before 9a, the prices are lower. Guest should explore the hotel; there is a great fitness area on 7th flloor AND a roof top garden/park type area. The roof top garden area has benches and tenns court PLUS a fabulous view of Camden Yards and Ravens stadium. (another sunrise opportunity). If I had to offer suggestions for improvement, they would be 1). Some of the waitstaff service in the Explorer Lounge was lacking in food &drink knowledge and service skill. Service was clumsy, not intuitive nor gracious. 2). The decor is a bit worn. I noticed some carpeting near ladies lounge that needs replaced. Overall,these are small critiques and does not prevent me from staying again- which I will. The front desk staff (Chris and Lotte are terrific and professional). Book the room!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for family and business”
Reviews.Author: skottilil
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my family. Great staff and excellent room service. The location is good and the views are picture perfect. The hotel is older, but clean and very close to the inner harbor. Indoor Garage Parking is available but at a price. There are several food options close to the hotel at the inner harbor, which is great. The rooms are quite spacious and clean. The interior decorations were all hip. Parking can be difficult in game days.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable New Year's Eve in the Harbour Court”
Reviews.Author: Bob D
Reviews.Content: We felt very welcome from the beginning till the end. When we entered the hotel the staff welcomed us very warm and attentive. From front office till bell staff and concierge. It is really a place where you feel at home. The junior suite we stayed in had a view over the city and the harbor which was very romantic. The room had a large bathroom with a huge tub and a walk-in shower! The fitness center with swimming pool and sauna is very impressive for a hotel! The inner harbor is right across the street. There you will find historic ships, the National Aquarium, the science center, and the world trade center with a tremendous view over the whole city. Furthermore, there is plenty of choice for drinks and food! It is a beautiful old European style hotel! There was a champagne bash in the bar with live DJ and an exclusive view over the inner harbor with New Year’s eve fireworks! Upon departure we felt like we lost new friends! We will return the coming years!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: rmdc29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time on New Year's eve to watch the fireworks at the Inner Harbor. The location cannot be better! You can see the fireworks from the front of the hotel. We booked a room that has city view. The room actually faces a parking lot with a partial view of the harbor. But since we actually did not stay in our room except to sleep, we did not mind the parking lot view. The front desk staff were very friendly and accomodating. It took ten minutes to check-in. valet parking was well worth the $36 with in and out priviledge. Two things kept me from giving it a five star. #1THE BED! I use a soft mattress at home. Their mattress was HARD! I woke up with a back ache. The pillows were super soft, though. #2 THE POOL! It was tiny and all around 5 ft deep. The water was questionably murky. I let my kids swim for half an hour. There was a life guard and that made me feel better. Overall, we will be back here on New Year's eve 2013!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: flippindick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my brother while attending a couple of games at Camden Yards in August. We were thoroughly impressed with the public areas as well as the rooms , the elevators , hallways and bars and restaurant are all in in very attractive condition. Our room was very spacious, and was decorated in a very tasteful manor. You certainly feel that you are in a four-five star hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: Mark L
Reviews.Content: Nice big room, but with a view onto inner courtyard rather than the harbour. The inner harbour is a good place to be in Baltimore in the evening, but this end of it gets very quiet at night - no safety issues that I noticed though. You do get complimentary WiFi (and we should all expect this now as industry standard), but you need to log on and accept a charge that is not actually added to the bill. The breakfast was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Your "Holiday Inn" is showing...”
Reviews.Author: DJWally
Reviews.Content: or maybe that isn't fair to some of the great Holiday Inns out there... It's a nice place, good rooms, no complaints there.... but if you are operating a bar (Explorer's) with premium prices, maybe invest in a few wine glasses?

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: jhop60971
Reviews.Content: Was there for a business meeting. Room decor seemed a little out of date. The catered food was average. Hotel service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Ambience”
Reviews.Author: islandjule
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Booked inner courtyard room, but was upgraded to city view (read: view of parking garage, church and science museum). Thank goodness we were upgraded, though, because inner courtyard room seemed like it would be dark since faced interior. Very spacious room with king bed. Decor was "rumpled elegance." Old school european, a bit worn around the edges, but very clean. In room Keurig for coffee and tea. Explorers Lounge for cocktails continues the elegant ambience with delightful views of the harbor. Staff very friendly and accomodating. Concierge arranged car (instead of taxi) for nomimal fee to get us to evening show. Great location as you can walk to all attractions at the Inner Harbor area. Wish we would had more time there to relax at hotel and try out the afternoon tea service. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: The first thing I anticipate when I travel is the initial treatment that I experience when I walk up to the entrance of my hotel. If I am greeted with an open door by a smiling employee that welcomes me and that theme continues through the check in and all the way through the bellman giving me a tour of my room and amenities I know that I made the right choice. I can truly say that I made the right choice here at the Intercontinental Inner Harbor, Baltimore. A special shout out to Nicole and Lotte at the front desk. R

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with AMAZING staff”
Reviews.Author: Zwein
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful with an old european ambience to it, rooms are spacious & very clean with very comfortable beds. Amazing view over harbor. Staff are very friendly and extremely helpful, always smiling and always very happy to help in any way they can! food both in room service and restaurants is very good! looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lost and Found deplorable”
Reviews.Author: cityslicker28
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but God help you if you leave something behind. I stayed there three weeks ago. Still trying to have my items sent to me. Trying to talk with someone who will actually be helpful but it isn't working. Very, very frustrating and everyone seems to have an attitude! I called on the day of departure and they had my items (a Talbots skirt and shirt). They were going to Fed Ex them the next day. Three weeks later, it's still a mystery. The head of security Mr. Van Horn says I am "threatening" when I express my dismay at the situation. Unbelievable. Next time, I will not be staying at the Intercontinental. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating!!”
Reviews.Author: Dot
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Harbor Court hotel numerous times in the past. In fact it has been our go to hotel when in Baltimore. As such, when we planned a weekend trip to Baltimore we just booked the Harbor Court again, expecting the same quality stay we experienced in the past. Not so. This hotel is showing its age, and it is not flattering! First off as we entered the room it smelled funny - like a combination of mold and rug deodorizer. In any event it was not pleasant and we had to open the window to clear it out. It never went away, but we got used to it I guess! The rug was also discolored throughout the room, in a very unusual pattern, making me wonder what had happened in that room to make it so. (Perhaps that explains the rug deodorizer smell??) The bed was absolutely the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. The thing just caved right in...and they had a feather bed on top of the mattress in an attempt to cover up how pathetic the condition of the mattress really was. The televisions are old school and not high definition. The tv in our room would decide to mute itself every half hour or so, without any reason. We would have to change the channel and then the sound would return. There is no turn down service at night, or else they skipped our room on both nights we were there. Buyer Beware - We booked a special rate with breakfast included, but you are unable to order breakfast for two without having to pay extra! The rate gives you a $42 credit for breakfast, but if you order a basic breakfast it costs $24 per person. The buffet is $25. So unless you have a bowl of cereal and pot of coffee, there is no way you are going to spend $21 a person. Kind of a shifty deal if you ask me. The in room safe did not work, and the whole place just needs to be updated. And good luck trying to get hot water in the morning....warm is about it. On the positive side, the location is exceptional. And the valet parking although expensive is responsive and professional. The coffee in the downstairs coffee shop is amazing. And the staff is very nice. It is just a shame that a hotel that we have enjoyed immensely in the past has gone downhill. And with the Four Seasons opening in a matter of days, this hotel needs to up its game. Just sad. Next trip to Baltimore we will try out the Four Seasons. Not as good of a location, but at least the beds will be comfy!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable Stay at A Prime location”
Reviews.Author: ErikontheGO
Reviews.Content: So if you're in Baltimore, I couldn't think of abetter place to stay. The location was ideal, right on the inner harbour and the accommodations very comfortable. I found the air impossible to work, so my room was much warmer than I prefer and I could hear my "neighbor" coughing plain as day. So not quit 5 stars but very close! The Bar on the second floor was a great place to enjoy a glass of wine and watch the boats move around the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: Doel G
Reviews.Content: Just a note to congratulate two Intercontinental Harbor Court Hotel employees who made our stay a most memorable one. Mr. Josean Rosado, executive chef, who prepared a wonderful lunch for my wife and I. Mr. Rosado prepared a 5 course lunch that will always be remembered. I would also like to mention Zoe at the Expresso Bar who made every visit a special one. These two employees truly exemplifies what excellence is all about! Congratulations on a great staff!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag...will pay better attention to tripadvisor next time”
Reviews.Author: fotocoquine
Reviews.Content: With our daughter attending college in Baltimore, my husband and I are regular visitors to the city, always enjoying our time. We decided to try the Intercontinental this trip based on the Inner Harbor location and our experience with other Intercontinental hotels. Our room here was a mixed bag. Following an early flight, there were a variety of rooms available, so we were able to check in early instead of having our luggage held. We were given the opportunity to upgrade our room to a waterfront view, however we declined as $50 plus taxes seemed high. This is where we should have followed advice from tripadvisor posters who had recommended the water view rooms. What I didn’t realize was that by not upgrading, our room faced a wall which I found to be a bit claustrophobic. I had also requested a quiet room away from the elevator, but our room was in the inner courtyard so we were closest to the elevator on our floor. This meant we not only heard the elevator clanking all night, but also heard a noisy group of guests coming and going in the hallway. I had planned on requesting a different room for our second night, however, we had early morning plans (and a train to catch) with our daughter, and the front desk was busy that morning. I slept with earplugs both nights. The next morning there were food bits outside of our door I had to step over. The positives on the room were that the bed was very comfortable and the room itself was spotless. The bathroom and shower were excellent with good water pressure. I swim whenever possible, but here I was only able to swim the second morning as the pool doesn’t open until 8am on weekends. I was glad to get to use the pool as it felt wonderful after a day of walking. The pool is not huge, but it is very attractive with a designated lap lane. A couple negatives - the hot tub was not working and dirty towels from the day before were piled up. The fitness area looked excellent and with warmer weather, there is also a sunning area outside the pool. The location is fantastic for enjoying the Inner Harbor. You have to cross Light Street (which is 6 lanes), but the Science Center is across the street, so there is a crosswalk. We had a drink at the Rusty Scupper, less than a five minute walk and enjoyed a superb harbor view while we watched the boats come in. We opted for the self –parking for $26/day. You take an elevator down to the lobby and then cross the driveway and take another elevator for the garage. It is not as convenient as the valet service ($48/day), but it was fine for us and we were in and out quite a bit. One perk is that you can use the lot all day after you check out, so we enjoyed the harbor right until we left for the airport. The staff we encountered was professional and when asked about our room, we were given a credit for the Internet charge. We had breakfast at Illy Café in the lobby – great coffee and some healthy breakfast options (try the Greek yogurt, fruit, and granola). Our room situation left me feeling like this was a mixed bag – otherwise my rating would have been higher.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Travel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Deborah P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Baltimore for a long weekend and stayed at the InterContinental Harbor Court on a friend's recommendation. Bless them. Everything about this hotel was great. This is a relatively small hotel with a very intimate and warm atmosphere. We slept the nights away in a very comfortable and quiet room and, in the morning, found our way to Espresso's (their coffee plus shop) for some of the best coffee (Illy) we have ever tasted and some fresh pastries. Because the hotel is across the street from the Inner Harbor, we were able to walk to many of the attractions and restaurants in the area and, when we tired a bit, we hopped on the free Charm City Circulator and toured more of the city. The hotel staff was extremely pleasant and helped us get the most out of our brief stay. We would definitely come back to the InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Service Par Excellence!!!”
Reviews.Author: NJCEO
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at this hotel was absolutely worth every dollar. Robert, the concierge on duty, made every possible concession to ensure that I thoroughly enjoy my stay. The care, concern, and dedication that he and the hotel staff provided should be replicated by all others. Truly, this hotel is one of distinction and excellence. Anytime I visit the Baltimore area, this will be my hotel of choice. Thank you Robert and the entire ICH staff for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: harry p
Reviews.Content: when ever we needed someone, regardless of how small the issue was, they were at our door exstreamly quick. Great professionalism and common courtesy. Very clean. The people at the front desk were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for only 2 nights; however, I wished it was longer. My room was surprisingly large for an inner city hotel and had great amenities. I enjoyed the TV in the bathroom the most. From the minute I walked into the hotel till the time I checked out, every staff member I encountered was friendly and professional. One in particular stood out, Mark from Valet. I was waiting at the Front Desk due to the guest in front of me having an issue with her credit card. Mark came right up to me and asked me if there was anything he could assist me with; I informed him that I was fine. He seemed genially concerned which was refreshing since a lot of the higher-end hotels the staff seems to act more like robots. When I was checking out; Mark quickly got my car and assisted me with my bags. He remembered me from standing at the desk, so he double checked to make sure I was able to obtain all the information that I needed. When I got in my car he gave me directions back to 95 as well as assisted with my seat belt; which was a first. Mark, just like the rest of the staff, truly cared about the guest’s wellbeing. All I can say is the hotel is all around wonderful; great location with views of the Harbor, great food, great atmosphere and exceptional staff!

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: tmzmet1
Reviews.Content: Its a nice very clean hotel... Beds are wore and need to be replaced..When I checked in the lady asked if I wanted to upgrade for $50.00 dollars..I said yes and when I went to check out it was $50.00 a day plus taxes....I was not happy!!!! They only would give me a $50.00 credit.... I have stayed at many InterContinental hotels in the past and never had anything like this happen... stay away from here......

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and well appointed”
Reviews.Author: mrsslk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for a 3 day conference this week. We were treated very warmly on check-in. Our room was very comfortable, bright, and well appointed. The place felt very clean. The bathroom was nicely remodeled. The bed was comfortable. We had coffee and breakfast every morning in the little coffee shop. Service was a little slow when it got crowded, but the breakfast offerings were perfect for our whole group and fairly priced. Coffee was excellent. We also liked the lounge! Our room was a beautiful corner room with a view of the harbor - very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1979
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the hotel and everyone was very friendly and accommodating. People seemed to enjoy working there and that makes a big difference. The rooms were cleaned to perfection and the food was delicious. I also enjoyed the fact that they have recycling bins in all their rooms and try to recycle as much as possible in the banquet space. The entire banquet staff was wonderful. I had placed a box for trash but thankfully the banquet server noticed there were still items in the bottom that I had forgotten to take out so he saved the box and had it delivered once I realized what I had done. Whew! Thanks IHG for a great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: HHFish
Reviews.Content: We attended a wedding here last Saturday, and had booked a room for the night as part of the wedding reservation block of rooms. We had a king room - great bed, nice sized room with very nice amenities. Keurig coffee maker with a nice selection of coffees and teas, very nice linens and towels. The only thing I believe they could do better is upgrade the toilet paper! The hotel staff were most helpful and friendly. We did valet parking, and when we checked out our car was brought up very quickly. The hotel did the catering for the wedding and the brunch the next morning, and the food was excellent. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewsMomCarmel
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for a wedding and spent two nights in the lap of luxury. The rooms are very large and well-appointed. Bathrooms even have a TV and phone! The staff is so accommodating. We had a few glitches upon arrival, but everything was resolved nicely. This is an old style charming hotel with all the conveniences. The pool was wonderful and quite large for a hotel. My only complaints would be the cost of valet parking and the exorbitant charge for internet in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay, Friendly Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: paola m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental recently with my baby and husband. After a long and scary drive thru the rain, we finally arrived at the hotel, which is conveniently located on the harbor and we were immediately attended to. It's an old and charming hotel yet impeccaply maintained and the staff was very extremely accommodating. The staff was extremelly helpful and friendly and I was pleased to see that a crib was waiting for us in the room. It was more like a 'play pen' but I was very please that it was in very good condition and nothing like what I had seen in other hotels - hospital looking cribs... The Pool/Fitness center was fantastic! You should also check out the Explorer lounge with all the antiquities. The valet//bellman parking staff was outstanding and I can't say enough about how efficient they were - the car was always ready for us when we needed it, of course, when calling in advance! :-) The room had a great view to the harbor - LOVED IT - but it does need some TLC, I wish they changed the red velvet carpet but truly you soon forget about it when you take a moment to enjoy the bay view and a nice flat screen TV. The barthroom was also nice and I enjoyed the TV in the shower. The hotel is conveniently located near the aquarium, children's museum and other fun places. Though it was a rainy weekend, we got the chance to enjoy it quite a bit and would definitely recommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: curtisrealestateco
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time! The courteous service started from the moment we pulled up to the hotel. The valet greeted us immediately and helped with our bags. The front desk was attentive and very friendly. The manager named Massimo welcomed us and made us feel as if we were VIP's. The room was fantastic and offered fantastic views of the harbor. We will back and we highly recommend this hotel. R. Curtis

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelNY_10
Reviews.Content: We checked in and from the lobby on this stay was a big disappointment. The hotel is in a wonderful location, right across from the science musuem down the street from the baseball stadium and the size of the room is wonderful but thats where the positives end. The hotel however is old, tired and in desperate need of some updating. We thought it was just our room but after 3 room changes realized it wasn't.TThey are a nice size but need some serious updating and redecorating. They appeared dirty. Great views when looking at the harbor, extremely dark when facing the courtyard...i found it depressing. I have stayed at other intercontinetal hotels and the service and amenities are not comparaible. This was a HUGE letdown!!! the woman that checked us in "helped with our bags". There was no turn down service nor friendly warm feeling when coming in and out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: pn52tap
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional when it comes to professionalism and courtesy!! The large rooms were absolutely gorgeous with huge bay windows that have a view of the harbor that rivals a postcard. Everything was within walking distance; the Harbor Cruise, the Aquarium; Children's Science Museum; Oriole Park at Camden Yards; Babe Ruth Museum; shopping and dining. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay - ate dinner at Brighton's restaurant which was delicious with superb service. In fact, we received outstanding service during our entire stay and definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a luxury hotel at a reasonable price!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed many times and will continue to come back...”
Reviews.Author: tjcheerio
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times while in town to visit family and I couldn't be happier. It's in a fantastic location and, like most Inter-Continental hotels, the staff is helpful in recommending and arranging things. I've never had a complaint staying here. The rooms are lovely and spacious and offer just about anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff; beautiful hotel; close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: prs2007
Reviews.Content: As part of a 3 day business event, we booked the Intercontinental to hold the meetings and of course to stay overnight. The hotel is well equipped for business events and their banquets/meeting staff were very knowledgable, helpful and responsive. The catering for meetings was acceptable with some highlights and a few disappointments. Overall we were very pleased. The hotel is across the street from the inner harbor and close to the night club area. So easy walking to all the fun things. The hotel rooms were clean, rather larger, and appropriately equipped for business travlers. In room internet is a must these days. The fitness center and pool (including hot tub) were very good although the pool has strange hours. It is open 5 am - 10 am and then closes till the evening. I believe the evening hours are 5 pm - 9 pm. So plan accordingly. Parking is outrageous and I recommend parking elsewhere. There are a number of parking options with better rates. You are within walking distance to Camden Yards (about 6 blocks) and I was lucky enough to catch a game one evening. Even if you aren't an Orioles baseball fan, you'll love Camden Yards. It is one of the nicest parks I've seen. Quick tip on the hotel lobby - there is a starbucks in the lobby but if it is closed, try the starbucks in the adjoining mall area....it is a quick 2 minute walk (in same building as hotel) and open longer hours. Fifth floor is where the fitness center and pool are located. You can request a room on that level if plan to use it frequently.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mark d
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay at this beautiful property! The location is fantastic, right beside the harbour; the rooms are great - really comfortable beds! I loved the 'luxury' feel of the open areas - the bar on the second floor has a great feel to it - and a great wine selection, and good food - try the crab-cake sandwich! And the staff were excellent, friendly, warm but efficient - I arrived late, and the doorman and check-in staff were welcoming and hospitable - made a nice difference after a long day of travel. Great place - I look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for inner harbor activities and view with service rivaling more expensive hotels.”
Reviews.Author: WorldtravelerB
Reviews.Content: This hotels location provides easy walking access to the inner harbor area and excellent unobstructed harbor views from the fifth floor or higher. If budget allows book one of the larger rooms with names like the Victoia room for a an exceptional hotel experience at well below the cost of similar accomodations in some US cities and Europe. The chandaliered well furnished rooms have two bay windows overlooking the harbor, comfortable king size bed and a large bath room with large walk in shower and oversized tub. The breakfast offering is buffet or menu. The selection is typical but good. There are many restaurants with in a 10-15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations in years - superb hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Joan K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to Baltimore Inner Harbor, and we could not have picked a better hotel. After reading the reviews for hotels in the harbor on Tripadvisor, we chose Intercontinental Harbor Court - and the stay was even better than anticipated. The front desk ,valets, restaurant and housekeeping staffs were all professional and courteous. Our room was beautiful - the harbor view was spectacular. Our room was clean, and maintained well during our three night stay. We went out the second day, and my husband realized he had left over $100 on the table. We were really concerned the money would be gone; our worries were for naught. I made sure we let the front desk know how honest their housekeeping staff was. We truly loved staying at the Intercontinental Harbor Court. This hotel is literally in the center of everything to do at the harbor. My husband is disabled, and he had no difficulty with getting around since we were so close to the restaurants, science museum, aquarium and the Gallery Mall. I would highly recommend this hotel, and we will be back again. Thank you for making our mini vacation a most enjoyable one!

Reviews.Title: “Our Daughter's Perfect Wedding”
Reviews.Author: RedfromOhio
Reviews.Content: Last night our daughter was married at the Intercontinental Harbor Court Hotel. After we booked back in Feb., we saw a few reviews that gave us pause. Any doubts about our choice were erased this weekend as our event was perfect! The hotel and rooms were spotless and the public areas—the lobby in particular—were simply gorgeous. We can’t wait to see the photos by Gary Guerva from Rodney Bailey’s on the winding staircase and in the library. The ambience in the Hamptons Room was cooled as requested and beautifully arranged and lighted, with a baby grand piano and beautiful wall draping. Cocktails followed in the Ravenhurst Room with guests being offered champagne, wine, or water by white gloved waiters as they entered that room. No lines resulted at the bars. The butlered appetizers were plentiful. Guests remarked over and again at how wonderful they were. The small crab cakes were delicious, closely followed by melt-in-your-mouth beef wellingtons, New England scallops wrapped in Applewood Smoked Bacon, duck quesadillas, brie and raspberries en croute, tiny macaroni and gruyere cheese bites with truffle oil. The display of Mediterranean vegetables, hummus, and pita was aesthetically pleasing and healthful. When we went into Whitehall Ballroom, it was exactly as we envisioned with white covered chairs, royal purple table runners, gorgeous lavender and blue flowers by Wicked Willow, hurricane candles encircled in roses, a beautifully displayed Sugarbaker’s wedding cake and a semi-circular sweetheart’s table for the newlyweds. The dinners of honey soy salmon and herb roasted chicken met our expectations. The parmesan bowl to serve the Caesar salad ahead of time and the strawberries and chocolates for a light pre-cake dessert were elegant. The servers were unobtrusively attentive. Jeff, the Director of Catering and Conference services was phenomenally organized and on top of every detail. Equally helpful and proficient in their roles were Scotlyn, the new catering manager; Miguel, the asst. director of Food and Beverage; and Lynnette, Banquet Server Extraordinaire. All of them were absolutely gracious to us and our guests. They went out of their way on so many little things, always with smiles on their faces. The bridal party was provided with the lovely Caucus Room to have a drink and appetizers in private for a few minutes right after the ceremony. Later, the staff saw that gifts, unity candles, reception book and so on were delivered to the bridal suite. The hotel even furnished a private break room (Homewood) for the Band (Love Seed Mama Jump). The band members raved about their dinners as well. After the reception, many of our guests proceeded to the Explorer’s Lounge Bar and enjoyed more live music and a fun atmosphere. The mother and father of the bride were given drinks “on the house” to celebrate our 41st Anniversary. It might be an understatement to say I am not an easy person to please and often write reviews when I’m dissatisfied. We’ve talked about the wedding all day and were truly 100% pleased. Great job, everyone at Intercontinental! To those reading, I highly recommend this venue!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with some nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: travelhutjo
Reviews.Content: Yes, some of the furniture is a little beat-up as other reviewers mentioned and our bed was actually missing a center leg when we got there. The maintenance man fixed it quickly and I can't say the furniture condition bothered me. The room was quite large with 2 easy chairs. We also enjoyed the Keurig machine which had several flavors to choose from. Front desk staff and the bellmen were friendly and gave some good sight seeing advice. The hotel is directly across the street from the inner harbor shops and boat tours, and an easy walk to Camden Yards (and the lightrail train that will get you to the airport). The pool was very refreshing after a hot day of walking around town, and was 5 feet deep which was nice for a hotel pool Many seemed to like swimming laps there as well. There was also a nice rooftop garden area outside the pool which had lounge chairs on as well. The work out room seemed well equipped. If you are not hung-up on the furniture, I recommend the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: SeabreezeNh
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to the inner Harbor. We stayed in two different hotels on previous visits. This hotel was the best experience of all. The hotel is lovely, the staff very accommodating,and the location can't be beat. We enjoyed it so much that we joined the Ambassador Club, and hope to repeat our experience many times.

Reviews.Title: “What a charming old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKBSTL
Reviews.Content: We just had a business meeting at the Intercontinental Baltimore. What a beautiful hotel. The location is amazing, right across the street from the inner harbor and close to museums and shopping! The antique artwork throughout the hotel is like walking through a mini museum. The rooms are very large and bathrooms are great as well. It was 105 degrees so the air did not work as hard as it should have. My room was a bit hot, I had a very prompt response when I called to have it looked at. Overall a great place to have a business meeting. The food was very good. It made a for a very nice business get away. I look forward to bringing my family back soon to enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “OTKAON 2011”
Reviews.Author: iam410
Reviews.Content: I would like to personally commend Annette at the Front desk and Larry and Martin in the Security for the evening of July 31st for their help, kindness and understanding with my situation. They went above and beyond to be sure he was safe. Unfortunately the so called friends and parents of the friends had a problem and without holding a discussion with the girls and my son (all 18) to hash out the problem they called me at 10 pm at night and told me they were not going to allow my son to stay at the hotel (which her paid his part for) or take him home to Rochester the next day (7 hours travel). They basically threw him out on the streets, no hotel rooms anywhere open due to the convention, no buses, trains or flights available at this time of night and didnt care where he went. Annette, Larry and Martin immediately helped me over the phone to assure his safety until we could drive the 7 hours to pick him up. The secured his belongings, they stayed in contact with me and my husband, they tried to find any possible hotel rooms near by (nothing available). They allowed him to stay in the lobby till we could get there. When another friend came to offer him to stay with them, Annette called me at 4 am to get approval, put my son on the phone so I can ok the situation. Prior to here leaving her shift at 7 am she again called to be sure I was on my way to get him and that he was safe. Security also protected him from the parents that were kicking him out when they rudley approached my son in the lobby and told him he needed to leave the hotel --security asked them to not speak to my son and stop harrassing him. For all their kindness and help I commend and thank them. This hotel is one I would hightly recommend due to the wonderful employees and the staff. Thank you--DoreenT. Swan

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: lcol0rsl
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the InterContinental without knowing what to expect of the hotel itself and their staff. I usually book whatever is available during the conventions I attend, so I have no expectations. However, I was immediately welcomed by the fantastic hotel attendants the moment I stepped in. The entire weekend I was met with enthusiastic, friendly staff members and consistently excellent service. The rooms themselves were absolutely gorgeous and spacious. I had even managed to get a room upgrade at no extra charge thanks to the incredibly sweet front desk associate. I am so pleased with this experience that I fully expect to return the next year for the next convention. I highly recommend this hotel and you will definitely not be disappointed by your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful professional staff”
Reviews.Author: DrDivaDrummer
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful visit at this hotel July 27-28. I would like to particularly commend Candice at the Expresso Cafe for her professionalism. She was serving a customer who became extremely rude simply because his bagel was toasted more than he liked. He was very rude to her. In the face of this inappropriate behavior, Candice remained professional and attemped to continue to serve this customer. No one should have been treated this way. I commend her for remaining calm and cool and remaining professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NJSunshine48
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed a weekend stay. The hotel is in an excellent location., directly across the street from the Inner Harbor. The staff was polite and we had a beautiful courtyard view room.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS! I loved it! Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: robigayle
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The staff was very warm and gracious. They really went out of their way to make feel comfortable and safe. I went to Baltimore for a business convention. My husband couldn't join me, so it was just me and my dog Emily travelling from Tennessee to Baltimore by ourselves. We drove nearly 11 hours straight and had reservations at another hotel in Baltimore, The Holiday Inn, but after 24 hours with no sleep due to constant issues in a room basically in the middle of the parking lot and being afraid to leave the room because of the street folks who would follow me as I was taking Emily out or just going to the main hotel to get food and drinks, I spent the night on the phone trying to find another hotel and finally came across the Intercontinental which fortunately had an opening and accepted pets. I was very upset and worn out by the time I drove over and the staff was wonderful from the doorman to the front desk, housekeeping, restaurant staff and management. They all made me feel safe and secure and were always willing to help with anything I needed. The hotel is beautiful and ornate and the staff though very elegant and professional, were very warm and approachable. I hated to leave. It was filled with charm and grace, something you just don't see in a lot of the hotels now. I would highly recommend it to anyone. It is more expensive than my company had budgeted for, but it was well worth it to feel safe and secure. I enjoyed walking to the harbor everyday across the street with Emily. The harbor park is a dog park and provides all the entertainment you could need. The view from the roof is awesome. I never thought I would enjoy staying in a big city like this, but if you could live at the hotel....it would be perfect..lol I can't thank everyone at this hotel enough for making my trip a lovely one. It was very stressful being away from home, driving so far, then having the problems I did at the other hotel as soon as I arrived, but the staff made me forget all that and I left Baltimore feeling nothing but relaxed and grateful for the opportunity to spend a week in such a fabulous town. Treat yourselves to something really special and spend some time at the Intercontinental Hotel. Just exploring the lobby, libraries, cafes and my favorite spot, the roof, where the view, zen garden, gazebo, pool and spa area is, was an adventure. My opinion of Baltimore could have been so negative based on first impressions at the "other" hotel, but after moving over to this hotel, I was truly able to experience Baltimore at it's best and I thank everyone at the IC Hotel Baltimore Harbor, for making this the best trip ever. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to see the Inner Harbor!”
Reviews.Author: alcwHouston
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff! If you want to see an Oriels game or spend time exploring the inner harbor of Baltimore, this is the place to stay. Could not ask for a better location...within walking distance of National Aquarium, USS Constellation, and tons of restaurants. FYI....the coffee shop in the hotel is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Will not recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: gtg1987
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my stay at this hotel. I was expecting so much more from the pictures and video and price of this so called 4 star hotel. The public areas were wonderful but the room had a lot to be desired for. There also seemed to be added charges that were not agreed upon, which after some time talking to management was taken care of. I def will not stay here again, the breakfast that was delivered to room also had a lot to be desired and was very pricey. The fitness room was nice but the pool very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: R0ssB
Reviews.Content: Great service. Every employee we saw said hello to us. Chris checked us in, very friendly. Location is wonderful, right at the habour and just blocks from Camden Yards. Parking tip: if you pay the garage directly there is no tax, but one day is 24 hours. If you pay the hotel, you pay tax but one day is considered 30 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful One Year Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: LEMT619
Reviews.Content: I will try to keep this review short, as I know short ones are easier to read. My husband and I live in DC, and wanted to have a fairly simple but romantic one year wedding anniversary. We stayed here the weekend of June 19th, and had planned on a regular room. When we arrived, we were offered an upgrade (for $100) to a thousand dollar suite. We jumped on it and we were NOT disappointed. It was a giant corner suite with two entrances, two restrooms (one quite large with a very large jacuzzi and tv), a king-sized bed, and French doors leading out from the bedroom into the living room. The living room had a very big tv, coffee table, a couch, and then a dining area with a separate table, etc. In the late afternoon, the staff sent up a bottle of cava (Spanish champagne) and chocolate covered strawberries. Delicious! One concierge member in particular was wonderful - I believe his name was Massimo...? Very gracious and he made us feel very special. Oh, and just one more thing - they even lent my husband a phone charger since he left his at home. Everyone really went above and beyond for us - we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: mjjmweiss7
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Intercontinental Harbor Court the weekend of my daughter's wedding at the same hotel. The wedding went off without a hitch. The staff and especially the management made sure the wedding was wonderful. It was a 5 Star affair. The entire hotel staff was also exceptional (including the front desk, restaurant, and bell hops), The room very comfortable, good size and clean. This was a wonderful experience. - JW

Reviews.Title: “short but very sweet stay”
Reviews.Author: Artificiosus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were traveling around the Annapolis/Baltimore area for a 4 day weekend and decided to stay our last night at this hotel. What a great stay... everything about this hotel was great, staff, location.... best view!!! a bit pricey.. but worth it!. Breakfast buffet could have been a bit more expansive... but more than adequate. All in all, a great stay in a great spot!! Would come again. It would be great if they offered free internet... 12.95 a day as it is.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance, Old World Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: LauraES
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel lobby, it was clear to me that this hotel is extremely elegant. From the paneled walls to the soaring chandelier, everything was in perfect condition. The woman at the front desk was very friendly and was able to promptly answer all of our questions. In our room, the AC wasn't working properly so we called the front desk to ask to be switched to another room. They handled the situation quickly and professionally and within minutes there was someone at the door with our new room keys. Our new room was absolutely stunning. The bathroom had a marble and stone sink and wall sconces and our room had antique wooden furniture. In addition, The bathroom had its own TV and small soaps and things. The room was extremely clean and the bed extremely comfy. The breakfast in Brighton's restaurant was delicious and so was the room service breakfast. I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and all the amenities it had to offer. Tip: Be careful of the breakfast package. They give you $42.08 credit for breakfast and anything above that they charge you.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf- Best Location”
Reviews.Author: atlbh_concierge
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice during the July 4th week and this hotel is top shelf all the way. I was checked in both times by Tonya- as a native she is a bulit in concierge & full service agent in one- very gracious and helpful. The room- spacious, great bed, flat screen TV's (in bathroom too) lovely furnishings. A polite young man from Philly brought me room service and was very knowledgeable and helpful about the city. I had breakfast and dinner through room service and both times were delicious. The location of this hotel couldn't be better as it is steps from the Inner Harbor- beautiful (must see Aquarium and Science Center). Also there is a free metro service called the circulator which is just steps from this hotel. Charm City is a perfect name for Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed, again.”
Reviews.Author: jdalexander
Reviews.Content: Returning guest are known to the staff and managers. No detail is too small to be overlooked. This is a first class hotel in every way. I have traveled around the world several times. Intercontinental is always my first choice when available. I look forward to my return to Baltimore as well as another stay at the Intercontinental .Harbor Court

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at its best”
Reviews.Author: dediehl
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The service was competent and friendly. Chad went well out of his way to assist with needs and the front desk personnel were always ready to please. The bar and resturaunt staff were pleasant and quick to respond to clientel. Overall, this was a great week away from the office enhanced by a great facility and support staff. Thanks everyone! D. Diehl

Reviews.Title: “great Service”
Reviews.Author: dlwkboca
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent..staff was personable and accommodating..world class...the public rooms are elegant , but the guest rooms are, sorry to say, "down at the heels", with beat up furniture and absolutely horrible mattresses ...nothing but springs with 2 inch feather bed toppers!! Ugh!! Hardly what one would expect in a 4 star hotel!! I was "prepared to be pampered " as the Frommer review suggested...instead we spent two sleepless nights! But, again the staff was terrific..Would we stay there again?? I'm not so sure...I would certainly research a few other 4 stars if there are any others...hate to think what a 3 star hotel in that city might be like!

Reviews.Title: “From beginning of my stay to the end of my stay the hotel was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Redmoonie
Reviews.Content: After a long redeye flight from Arizona, we arrived just after 10 am and was greeted at the cab door by the bellstaff with a smile. We walked into the main lobby and was greated with smiles by the two ladies working at the front desk. Our room was ready and we were escorted to our room an given a quick tour of our room and amenities. The suite was perfect with one of the best views of the harbor. One of the best places to take pictures of the harbor was from our room. The oversize room and bathroom was more than accomidating. The bath tub was like a small private pool with a tv close by...one could live on the bathroom alone. With only two days we hit the ground running to see all that Baltimore had to offer. But before departing the resort we stopped by the concierge for recommendations. The concierge had a great. He had a great recommendation for lunch and assisted with ideas on transportation around the city. After a busy day of sight seeing we decided to sleep in. Before heading out for the second day we had a quick bit to eat in the coffee shop. The wonderful ladies behind the counter were great and the breakfast croissant was perfect. No matter what time of day/night or who you encountered around the hotel the staff was very friendly and wonderful with suggestions. I recommend the resort not only for the perfect location to the harbor, shopping, sight seeing, and restaurants...but for the staff and their hospitality in their home/city.

Reviews.Title: “Home with a view”
Reviews.Author: TrippedReview
Reviews.Content: What a magnificent place! We stayed Monday, 13 Jun 11, in a Deluxe Harbor Front room and the view is incomparable. After spending a considerable amount of time looking for the perfect place to see and access Baltimore's Inner Harbor, it still surpassed my expectations. From the moment we walked in, we felt welcomed. The concierge, doormen and staff were all wonderful and eagerly answered any questions we had. The complimentary lemon/orange water in the lobby was refreshing and decor astounding. When I opened the door to our room overlooking the Harbor, the kids ran to the window in awe and immediately began pointing out all the neat things we could see.
