We were fortunate to have a full moon light the water at night to see the sun rise is indescribable. We watched the boats slip in and out, joggers running by and had perfect views of the Science Center and Aquarium. The room, especially the Deluxe Harbor Front, is not inexpensive, but is comparable to the other hotels nearby. What sets it apart is the amazing staff, beautiful apportionments and what I believe is the MOST amazing view of the Harbor. It doesn’t get any better. Of note: if you are traveling with luggage, make sure to stop by the entrance to the Hotel off Light St and drop it off prior to parking in the garage. As we had parked and visited the Science Center before checking in, we (our choice) needed to lug our through the garage to the elevator to the first floor across the garage entrance and into the back entrance to the Hotel then to the elevators and up to our floor. I am sure had we asked the more than helpful staff would have assisted us once we were in the hotel. The parking garage is down the one-way side street so when you leave it is the same drill or you'll need to pull your car around the block.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and well worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: ILLV
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend to meet up with family for a mini reunion. This could not be a better location. The Inner Harbor is directly across the street and Camden Yards is a short and safe walk. The room was lovely. My nephew loved the flat screen in the bathroom so he could watch tv while taking a bath. The service is excellent. Check in was smooth and the employee behind the front desk must be beating suitors off with a stick with his friendliness, French accent, efficiency and smile/wink. Check in literally took about 3 minutes and we were off to our room. Late one night my husband simply wanted a soda and the security guard noticed us looking around and opened the coffee shop that was closed to get him two bottles of soda. How nice was that? We plan on writing a letter to his boss about how nice that was of him. Every time we entered the hotel, the valet would open the door for us even though there is a revolving door. We asked for additional towels and had them at our door within five minutes. You can valet park or turn right on Lee Street and self park in the Harbor Court garage with an easily accessible secure entrance. Very easy. We parked the car and walked everywhere. The beds were extremely comfortable as well. Again, an impressive hotel due to location, service and beauty. You don't go on vacation to save money, so if safety, location and top notch service are important, it is well worth the price. HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: skirkla1
Reviews.Content: I went to Baltimore with my father to visit Johns Hopkins Hospital as he has a health problem, stayed at this hotel for two nights. First let me address some of the comments I've seen on this site. One reviewer called it "your grandmothers house" I guess because the decor is Early American.....which may not be your style but if you think about it Baltimore is an old east coast city so the decor is probably pretty appropriate. Furniture in the rooms is pretty beat up, but I doubt your grandma's house had marble baths. They upgraded us to harbor view rooms, unfortunately the center vision panel in my room had a bad seal, so it was pretty much opaque....so much for the view. They apparently recently replaced the fixtures in the baths, and they are cheap stuff. Beds had feather pad and duvet and pillows, not so good for everyone and perhaps in lieu of upgrading from mattresses in poor condition....but staff knew how to exchange all that stuff for hypo-allergenic. Hotel is located on the frog hairs of the tourist area on the inner harbor, many other hotels more central. One restaurant and one bar on an upper level were pretty quiet, but food and service were five star. Kudos to Cameron in the bar for excellent service and hospitality. Rooms division staff were extremely nice and really went out of their way to accomodate our individual needs.....a special thanks to Alejandro at the front desk, a top notch professional who really cares, doormen went out of their way to help in any way, staff thereby made an otherwise so-so hotel visit a great stay. Agree with other reviewers that charging for the ethernet in the room is very tacky, just because the competition does it does not mean the Intercontinental has to follow suit. Likewise the charge for parking....and I saw signs at neighboring facilities, hotels and public, with stiff parking charges, guess it's a Baltimore thing. But here again my own feeling is bump the rate $20 and offer "free" internet and "free" parking....guests will be happier with that, product differentiation you see. Noteworthy that the Rooms Manager reads these reviews and responds, so he obviously does care and that is reflected in the attitude of his staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Edward455_11
Reviews.Content: There was a mistake in my booking made through an internet website (probably my own fault) and when I checked in my prepaid stay was for another day. The very helpful staff (especially Michelle Bennett) went of their way to ensure that the booking was transferred to that night at no additional cost to me. They were unfailingly pleasant and cooperative. As for the hotel, it's an oasis of calm and relaxation amidst the excitement of the Baltimore Inner Harbor and a great base for exploring the many attractions that the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant property, beautiful view, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Finleypoint
Reviews.Content: A lovely two day stay. We had a room with a view of the harbor. From check in until check out, hotel staff was corteous and kind, always with a smile. The Fitness center was up to date and fully equipped. Ice cold cucumber water waiting in the lobby was a great touch. The rooms manager heard we were in town for a special occasion, introduced himself and sent up a very nice amenity. We look forward to returning to Baltimore and staying at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: rlenoir
Reviews.Content: I have been to many meetings in Baltimore and this was the first time I had been in the Intercontinental. It was a great hotel. Right across from the Inner Harbor, with Harbor side rooms having a great view. Food was excellent. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Lovely hotel that penny pinches”
Reviews.Author: gianabanan
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, conveniently located down on the Baltimore Harbor. The rooms are spacious and elegant. I am so glad I received a great deal on my room because when I arrived, I was charged $47 for valet, and had to pay for my internet access in the hotel (if I went to the lobby, the internet was free. Really). On this trip I stayed at many different types of hotels, and internet access was free. For breakfast, go to the little illy Coffee shop adjacent to the hotel. It is basic but the coffee is awesome and so is the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TDDToronto
Reviews.Content: Harbour view room, across street from harbour, restaaurants, shops, aquarium, historic ships. Couldn't ask for a better location. Comfortable large room, a little dated but well appointed kept. Avoid the breakfast - $25.00 for a basic bacon and two eggs, juice, coffee and deep fried frozen patoato tots.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: NedimMakar
Reviews.Content: We have been to the InterContinental with a large international group. Great hotel and kudos to the German manager at the Front Desk. He gave us a great service and ensured we had a very pleasant stay. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at the harbor”
Reviews.Author: lowxr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it clean and well maintained. The staff were friendly and very helpful. It is located right at the inner harbor and a short walking distance to everything, even Camden Yards baseball Stadium. Breakfast was very pricey and not worth the money, the hotel isn't cheap but it is a good value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_89026
Reviews.Content: Due to a personal situation, we stayed at this Intercontinental hotel for an extended period of time. I have nothing but kind remarks and gratitude to the all of the staff for making our stay as comfortable as possible, especially Zorbey at the front desk. He accommodated and helped with our requests with great attentiveness and care. We couldn't have asked for better friendly face at the front desk. The rooms are very comfortable, clean, and have a beautiful European decor. A little slice of heaven in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a really wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: kab231
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Harbor Court Baltimore is a beautiful place and the views of the Inner Harbor are great, especially at night. The staff was very professional, extremely courteous, and more than helpful! Harbor view room with small fridge & coffee was terrific! Lounge and restaurant well appointed - food very tasty. And room service food late at night came hot and quickly, and did not cost that much more than restaurant's. This is a terrific InterContinental Hotel - very well situated re Inner Harbor. Museums (go see Visionary Museum for something unique), restaurants, stores etc. are easily accessible by walking or by water taxi and free bus line. Getting to and from hotel via 395 etc easy as well. [Kudos to Chad & staff in making it a great place!]

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing one night stay!”
Reviews.Author: carissae
Reviews.Content: From the moment of check-in until check out, the service was impeccable! The hotel is so beautiful, it reminds me of the many stays I had in England. A must try is the Explorer's Lounge for afternoon tea as well as breakfast at Brightons restaurant. I had table overlooking the harbor and could watch the joggers as well as families go strolling by at the harbor as I sip on my tea. A most delightful 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, fantastic customer service.”
Reviews.Author: NOYB90
Reviews.Content: Stayed the week for business training. The location was perfect to the harbor, the food and ambiance of the hotel were very good. The main reason I am commenting here is because of the supurb, beyond the call customer service I received on the last day of my stay. Training to Washington, DC I had more than I could carry. Fumbling with luggage and a box I had hoped to mail home on checkout, I found out there was no post office nearby and FedX/UPS/Priority Mail was too expensive. Ms. Annette B. at the front desk immediately helped me weigh the box, looked up the parcel post rates online and then, amazingly offered to take the box with her on the way home and mail it, which she did. She saved my old bones/back and personally assissted me with no expectations of anything other than helping a customer. In this busy, sometimes mean old world, I think that Ms. Burman's instant offer of help, which she delivered, was fantastic and worthy of praise.

Reviews.Title: “Special Treatment”
Reviews.Author: GreekMik1
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were staying to celebrate our 6th wedding anniversary. From the moment of our arrival, we were treated by the professional staff. Upon check-in, we were given an upgraded suite and "Couples Package", once staff became aware of our "special" stay. Room was quite comfortable with a fabulous view of the Inner Harbor and room service selections were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a rip off!!!”
Reviews.Author: plurplszr
Reviews.Content: I previewed a ton of hotels before choosing the Intercontinental soley based on pictures. For 200 dollars a night I thought for sure it would be a very comfortable place to stay for one night. I really looked forward to using the jetted tub as shown on line. I also paid extra for valet service. The moment we pulled up and checked in the valet "suggested" we park ourselves if we were just bringing our stuff in then going out. We had to pay 8 extra dollars on top of what we already paid for parking. When we went to our room the "floor to ceiling" windows looked rigt out onto a courtyard and everyother room. No sight of the harbor seen. The bathroom was small, no jetted tub, and no water pressure either. The towles had holes in them! The mini bar was locked with only complimentary tea and coffee, but no instructions on how to use the coffee maker. The bedroom furniture was tiny compared to the room size. The dust was four inches thick behind the headboard, yuk! The night stand was chipped and worn. The tv is small and the reception was poor. I asked the front desk for a password to use wifi, and the clerk was pretentious in telling me it was 12.95 a device per night to use! You've got to be kidding me. I could have paid half the price for a room at the Holiday Inn and would have had free wifi and some vending machines atleast! This place is not worth than money, and the pictures online are terribly deceptive. I will never stay here again, and would not recommend this place to anyone but my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Peterdela
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started staying at the Intercontinental Baltimore about six years ago in conjunction with visits to Johns Hopkins University Hospital. There is a discount for JHU visitors. We lucked into a free upgrade to a junior suite overlooking the inner harbor and it has been a favorite. Pet friendly. The staff has been great from the doormen to room service. Even pre-checkin has been great with Zorbey on our last reservation. You have to work it a bit to speak to a reservation person in Baltimore as the standard response is to transfer to some central reservation service.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor Court is still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: garys12345
Reviews.Content: This hotel has impeccable service. Always has. They know to look for what you want. For example while in the Brighton for breakfast on server was told to clean a table by the door for us, he saw me looking at the seat by the window that opened, he immediately stopped cleaned that table, smiled and invited me over. The general condition has declined, age and the recension certainly has something to do with it. That being said rose petals on your pillow for turn down service, and a staff that is always paying attention to the guest is not something you find anywhere. Even the Ritz doesn't have staff like this. I'm sorry to see they removed the old phone booths on the second floor, surely they were never used but it took you back the the time of true class. The worst thing, absolutely heartbreaking is that the Hampton's restaurant is closed :( All I can say is there was never a restaurant with better food or service in the world than the Hamptons. It truly showed this hotels dedication to service. It was ungodly expensive but you got every penny you paid back in service and quality! So yeah you might have dropped $240 for a meal for two but you were never treated better in your life. I hope one day this economy turns around enough that they can reopen it one day. They need to do some general improvements which are probably on hold because who is paying $300 for a room in Baltimore anymore? However, you can never complain about service here, unless that is, you're sitting in your room griping about it and not letting them know! If you have an issue tell them and they WILL fix it. My chief complaint, I cannot for the life of me remember what movie this hotel was featured in :) Keep up the good fight, keep this hotel open until we're back on top and then get it back to 100% of its glory..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: NateB57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had researched Baltimore hotels before booking our V-day weekend. Needless to say, we choose the Intercontinental and are so glad that we did. As many of the reviews already mentioned, the staff was excellent, from the bellmen, to the front desk, to the waiters at the restaurant. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. We plan to try to stay at other Intercontinental hotels in our future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: djn_psp
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business, I wish all of my hotel stays were as pleasant as this one. The room was very comfortable and spacious with an amazing view of the harbour. Every staff member that I had contact with were friendly, knowledgable, and professional. I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, staff, hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: aislinnmill
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped onto the property at the InterContinental, we were greeted with such unbelievable hospitality that made us feel welcome and at 'home.' We travel all over the country and various part of the world and I can say that our experience at this hotel is above and beyond the very best I have experienced in all of my years of travel. Every member of the staff was extremely helpful and put on an amazing corporate event for us. The food was spectacular and the rooms were more cozy and comfortable than home. I would stay here any chance I could get!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel With a Remarkable Staff”
Reviews.Author: vjak19
Reviews.Content: From the moment of my arrival to the time that I left, everything was absolutely perfect. I had the opportunity to dine in both the restaurant and snack in the coffee shop. Both were over the top. The crab cakes alone would bring me back. The view from my room overlooking the Inner Harbor as the moon rose in the night sky was breathtaking. Nothing was left to chance, everything was thought of and right at your fingertips. As delightful as the hotel, room and facilities were, the real ambiance of this wonderful hotel is in its staff. I have never stayed anywhere that the staff members were more pleasant, concerned or helpful. I was immediately made to feel like an honored member of their family. My only disappointment was in having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hospitality And We Haven't Arrived Yet!”
Reviews.Author: TomCruises
Reviews.Content: Hello! I have to comment on the professionalism and responsiveness provided by Mr. Massimiliano Puglisi of the InterContinental Harbor Court Baltimore.From the very beginning,just a few weeks ago,he has been able to arrange accomodations for split stay,facilitated parking arrangements and recommadations for both restaurants and activities in the area.We anticipate a wonderful experience at the InterContinental as we near our upcoming visit.I strongly recommend enrollment in the Ambassador Program available at InterContinental.Contact Massimiliano and he will happily share information with you.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance”
Reviews.Author: zampanokc
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a weekend stay here, while attending a family wedding that was held in the hotel. The front desk staff members were very courteous and helpful, as were the doormen and other staff members. My room was spacious, with a well-appointed bathroom. I had a courtyard view, but the hotel has a beautiful view of the Inner Harbor. The hotel bar is beautiful--perfect for an intimate drink. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: msteinruck
Reviews.Content: After local advice that this was one of the more up-scale hotels in the area, I paid for a "Deluxe Harbor View" for an anniversary stay with my wife. Thought "deluxe" might mean something. Maybe a little higher up, or a nice living area (couch, etc.). Instead, it was a pretty average hotel room with just one leisure chair for relaxing. (Not ideal for a two-person stay.) It was on a lower-level floor, and situated over either an event or a bar - the noise from the band/DJ bled through the floor. Internet is extra, and no complimentary breakfast. Next time, I'll stay in a Marriott or something. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC FOR ANYONE”
Reviews.Author: lba0117
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my wife a daughter (14) and another family. The hotel is beyond 5 stars, the location and view is superb, the staff is exceptional, the rooms felt as if we were the first gusts ever to stay there. Breakfast and dinner were both simply perfect. I recommend to have dinner at the surprising superb restaurant. We are Ambassador members and received an upgrade, just as promised, i recommend the membership, it is a great value. This hotel is great for a romantic get a way or with the entire family.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: lovelylady22
Reviews.Content: We arrived and waited patiently for someone to wait on us in the lobby. (We had people cutting in front of us) Finally we got up to someone, and they asked us our parties name and when he said three adults, the lady standing next to the gentleman helping up, stopped what she was doing and goes "the three of you are staying in one room?" (It was a girls weekend to just get away) She had attitude about it, but thats how they let us book it. So we get up to our room and the rugs were slippery? This was the least of our worries. We had two beds that were supposed to sleep four adults. So we went down stairs to see if we could get a roll away bed so we could sleep comfortably. Thats when we were told it was a fire hazard. But we were originally told we could have a roll away, and we paid extra for it. They ended up changing out room. We went from a room with a view, where we could see the harbor. To a room that you could only see their inner court. It was a little disappointing. We had high hopes that this room would be amazing and it was less than par. I will be returning to The inner harbor, but I think I might try a different hotel next time. . .

Reviews.Title: “This is an outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveler778
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The staff was extremely courteous. The facilities were clean and included a nice gym. The food was outstanding. A real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay and Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: citoyennea
Reviews.Content: If you arrive via Penn Station, there is a Purple Bus Circulator which is free, and stops next to the hotel. It's in an ideal location as it's right next to the inner harbor and you can walk to most venues with ease. The hotel has a very "colonial" charm. I prefer modern hotels so I was not overly impressed with the decor. When I checked in, I inquired about any preventative measures that the hotel undertook for bedbugs and was quite pleased to hear about the methods that they employed. The room was very clean. I received my welcome refreshments in a timely manner. I was given a harbor view room which was large and comfortable. The room has a decent sized safe, offers free wireless for Ambassador members and the bathroom has a nice soaking tub. The decor is a bit dated, but not tacky. My only complaint was that the mattress should have been replaced as the side nearest the hallway was woefully worn -- it was sunken and quite hard. Fortunately, the other side of the bed was not slept on as often so it was completely comfortable. The gym is adequate, albeit a bit cramped -- it has every machine that you would need and the indoor swimming pool was an additional perk. Room service was not spectacular, but not unreasonable. I had a pleasant stay and would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Serene - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AlanTizzle
Reviews.Content: This was such an excellent adventure away from home here in NYC. I went on a business trip and only stayed overnight but from the moment my car pulled into the driveway with the water fountain, I just knew! I was going to enjoy my night of sleep at this hotel. Then checking in with the wonderfully talented Zorbey who handled everything with ease and with care. To having dinner in the beautiful Restaurant called Brightons with the amazing, funny, sociable Gina who was just awesome. I really enjoyed my stay here and hope to be back again. Thanks everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lothie
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! The staff was wonderful from the time I checked in until I left. I was there for just one night but wish I could have stayed. I had an awesome sleep, and a wonderful breakfast. I took a short bath the evening I arrived while watching TV. I spent some time on the Internet, and I also ate my breakfast in the room the next morning. All in all, it was a great experience and I'd love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fell asleep for Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: gorah123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed to attend a wedding on Black Friday. We experienced multiple problems:no electric sockets working in the bathroom or for one of the lamps; despite a confirmation that our room would be cleaned when we were out, it did not happen; wedding welcome packs prepared by the bride that should have been distributed never arrived, cold public areas (reception staff kept warm with an electric fire behind their desk!), restaurant not open for 2 nights due to low occupancy-whilst the same menu was on offer in the Explorers Lounge, on one night there were noisy football supporters there watching game on TV-not accepatable in my view. Reception staff were very difficult when a late check out was requested-presumably because we had complained about other issues. Eventually the management stepped in, we got an apology and agreement to a late checkout of 6pm-this is exceptional I know but in view of our experiences and the low occupancy at the hotel, it was at least something the hotel could do for us. The late check out was much appreciated. However, to our amazement, when we returned to our room to pack our last items of clothing about 4pm we found them out of the drawers and removed from the hangers and lying on the furniture in the room. The maid said she did not know where we were and had not been told there was a late check out. Why that gave her the right to touch our property I do not know. So, the only reason why we did not rate this hotel in the lowest category was because the management at least recognised their shortcomings and tried to rectify. Lots of reviewers claim they are experienced travellers but I have stayed in over 400 hotels around the world in the last 10 years. Many US hotels are over-rated and this one certainly is. This hotel has a serious training need. One member of staff was very good-she served us at breakfast several mornings and was very concerned when she was unable to produce drinkable cappucino when we had to have dinner in the Explorers Lounge-clearly a consequence of a closed dining room! The guys at the door were also very pleasant-especailly when compared with the reception staff

Reviews.Title: “Front desk needs work, otherwise a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights for a conference at the Baltimore Convention Center. It's about 2 blocks further than most other hotels to the Conference Center and light rail station, but this wasn't an issue for me. I had a good half day before and after the conference to visit Baltimore. I came in a bit before noon, and my room wasn't ready so they took my luggage and I gave them my cell phone number to call me when it was ready. I can't agree with a number of reviewers who felt that the hotel isn't luxurious, although I can agree with a recent reviewer who criticized the front desk. I asked how to get to the Baltimore Museum of Art by public transportation. The concierge desk had a sign saying it isn't even manned until 3 PM! That's not what I expect out of a luxury hotel. Well, one front office employee had never heard of the museum, and the other had no idea how to get there other than to take a cab. I did take a cab and while at the museum learned that there's a direct bus which goes within 2 block of the hotel. (Ended up being the same story 4 days later when I went to Fort McHenry). When they called me when my room was ready, I asked for my room number, because I was going to meet a friend later on. The response was "I would tell you, but then I'd have to change the room number." Leaving aside the issue that there was no logical reason not to tell me my room number when they were calling me with a number I gave them (having left my photo ID), there was certainly no reason to give me a snide answer. I can understand an employee having to follow instructions which don't always make sense, but a simple "I'm afraid I'm not allowed to give that information over the phone" would have been more polite. Of course, at Hilton group hotels, I can select my room over the internet a day in advance, so I don't see the issue in the first place. Having Platinum status means nothing in InterContinental hotels (and most other hotels in the InterContinental Hotel Group, unfortunately), but Ambassador status does, so I was upgraded to a room facing the harbor. No fresh fruit as the Ambassador website promises, but some chocolates made up for it for this Belgian-American. The room was large, beautiful, and quiet, with no earplugs needed. There's a large bathroom with a nice tub from which one can watch TV (separate TV in the bathroom). No HD in either TV, though. They have a very nice gym and spa facilities, as well as a nice pool and even tennis courts. I enjoyed my stay here, and can only suggest they hire a full-time concierge and perhaps give the front desk staff a little more training.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dcento
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary. This was the first time we had stayed at this property. We loved the location. Our first night there was not the best due to some noise/heating issues, however, the staff was fantastic and did everything they could to make our second day/night better. All of their efforts made the second leg of our trip great.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but Goodie”
Reviews.Author: Redsox1988
Reviews.Content: This was a nice Intercon, it is an older property but is cleaned up and maintained very well, has a feel of elegance when you walk into the building, Bellman are always around and ready to help. Check in was quick and easy, the same at check out, were nice engough to give me an extended check out until 1pm. Very Close to the harbor and Baltimore night life. Most impressive was the turndown service, checked in at 3pm left at 5pm came back at 8 the room was entirely cleaned again with mints on the pillow WHOA, another unique but funny thing was a televison in the bathroom. Good bath products and decent mini bar selection and prices, Free Kreurig in the room for coffee and tea, and alot of HD channels. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The InterContinental is an excellent place to stay in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: JenPowell21
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is located right on the harbor making it very easy to walk to all the local attractions. You can park your vehicle for the duration of the stay and not have to worry about entering and leaving the parking garage several times. The accomdations are very nice and the beds are very, very comfortable. Being a mother of a 1 year old, that was the best night's sleep I have had since she was born! I would definitely return to this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “would not suggest”
Reviews.Author: dgb
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is worn and not at all an intercontinental. For comparison, it is roughly a Ramada Inn with higher prices and a grand staircase. The inner harbour area for dinner was off putting as there were groups of teenage boys looking for trouble and security guards patrolling it. this was a friday night though, but I definitely did not feel comfortable there and we go to NYC all the time. Just a weird place. The Valet and the front desk were nice though----

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced and NOT for children.”
Reviews.Author: mamallama3
Reviews.Content: We were going for a quick getaway to the Inner Harbor and booked this hotel based on a recommendation. We arrived at 2 and our room wasn't ready until after 6. The valet outside was super friendly and helpful. The desk help could not point me in any directions of activities with young children. I asked for brochures or guides on the city and they said they had very limited, none of which included anything we were interested in. We went on our way and came back to the hotel for a swim @7. The lifeguard was not too thrilled to see children. We were the only ones in the pool (a beautiful pool and fitness center) and stayed for a little while. There is no gift shop, paid $6 for an apple juice to get the little one something to drink. The room itself was very nice, very clean. Breakfast was $80, half of which was included in the package. The valet parking of $36 was included in the package. Overall, it was a very expensive night in a hotel that did not accommodate to children. This definitely is a place for business travelers. Again in the morning, asked another employee for suggestions with young children and they could not offer up anything. We requested a late check out, no problem at all. Tried to connect to WiFi using laptop, they wanted to charge us!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk service was terrible”
Reviews.Author: archae0logist
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were greeted at the front desk by a man who was extremely condescending because he could not see the rate that we had paid since we booked through Priceline. We asked for an extended checkout because my spouse was running in the marathon and he was snippy about it and I had to wait for a phone call from the general manager to find out if we could have a later checkout time. In the meantime, we were left wondering whether or not my partner would have a place to shower following the race. (As an aside, we stayed at the Marriott Inner Harbor the previous year and there was no problem with a late checkout for runners.) The rooms were opulent, but the service was so bad and the guy at the front desk was so condescending that I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Guest Services Lacking”
Reviews.Author: arlo6
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel located right on the Inner Harbor. Our room was very comfortable although we had to change rooms because the first one was too small for us. It did require an upgrade but was worth the money because the second room was much more spacious for our family of four. My only issue with the hotel was the lack of a concierge or anybody at the hotel who could help us out with recommendations for restaurants or provide us with any suggestions for sightseeing etc. I did speak with the concierge at the hotel prior to our visit and was told he would put together a listing of sights and restaurants for us to visit during our 3 day stay. When we arrived no one had any idea about this and for the three days of our visit there was no concierge on duty. The front desk folks although pleasant were not very helpful in this regard. I was surprised that a hotel that one would consider high end did not have anyone who could provide this level of service. Overall, staffing seemed to be lacking not so much in quality but in quantity.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay....Great location to Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: akkabk6
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Saturday morning and was warmly welcomed upon our arrival.We had a quick weekend trip with our family of 9 there to enjoy a quick reunion together and enjoy the Inner Harbor. The rooms were spacious and the staff were all very friendly and all seemed wanting to insure we had a good experiance.Great coffee shop on site......thanks to Jerome for taking our family picture Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: writeway00
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night rip for my boyfriend's birthday and was not disappointed!! We got an upgraded suite and it was fabulous! The service was great and so was the food at the hotel restaurant. We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tauysal
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with very helpful front desk. Spacious rooms with great views of the Baltimore harbour. It only takes a 2 minute walk to get to the harbour area with restauarants, bars and other entertainment. Fantastic bed, not too soft, not too hard, just right! I received free internet service but that was because I am an Ambassador with Intercontinental hotels. The gym up on the top floor was great, I worked out every day. They have elipticals, stairmasters, stationary bikes and treadmills in addition to weight machines. There is also a spa but I think you have to pay extra for that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location--- Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: piersonhut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the intercontinetal and had a wonderful quick weekend away. The hotel is right next to the inner harbor. While we were there we walked to an orioles game. (Make sure to buy water and snacks on the way in, your allowed as long as you don't open them until inside the ballp[ark). Also, we enjoyed the hotel's pool- very nice. There is a small shop in the hotel where we got a light breakfast each day, and the staff there was very friendly and helpful. The hotel also offers a great room service menu, though a bit pricy. Several musuems and attractions are right across the street. Rooms are very clean and ours had an incredible harbor view. Overall an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmbkspc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very elegant and quiet. The service was very courteous and friendly. The room I stayed in was very clean and nice. The carpet in the room was so soft on my feet...which surprisingly was a key feature for me with all the walking I had done. The view from a double bed room was not so great. My view was of the court yard. I would of preferred a view of Baltimore's harbor. There were not alot of food choices. One resturaunt was Brightons and it was very good. We had an excellent breakfast there, but I chose to eat lunch and dinner on the harbor. There are more choices on the harbor. The location to the harbor is right across the street it was not far to walk at all. Great experience otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - perfect getaway and great location for all things Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_Shopper
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in close proximity to the M&T Bank Stadium for the 2010 NCAA Lacrosse Finals. Well, it really was a great location. Not only was it in walking distance to the stadium, but it was also even more accessible to the Inner Harbor. We never needed our car! The hotel itself was great. I have no complaints at all. The room was nice and comfy - - very nice bathroom, lots of space, comfy beds and we all enjoyed ourselves. The only problem I had, and it was a small one, was that they wanted to charge me an extra $30/night for my 15 yr old son, when I had the room rate confirmed. Good thing I had my blackberry with me. I dug up the confirmation email that Intercontinental sent me and all was fine. So, all in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “why pay $200 to stay at your dirty grandma's house?”
Reviews.Author: tattooedtravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this "4 star" hotel, for luckily only one night, we arrived to an extremely rude valet/bellhop, who demanded we move our car before we could get our pass to park it, which cost an extra $20. Our room was absolutely filthy, excrement stains on the toilet, layers of dust everywhere, a broken tv, face/finger prints on every piece of glass, and the furniture looked like it had been purchased from an elderly person's estate sale. On top of that they were asking $15 to use their internet per day, plus $15 for breakfast. The only redeeming quality was the service provided by the concierge. This place sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Expected way more--”
Reviews.Author: MaxandLola
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at an Intercontinental before and had thought it was a better chain. We stayed one night. Good location in the Inner Harbor, but we hope this is not the best that Baltimore has to offer. We were first given a smoking room (we were not asked and forgot to specify) that smelled awful. In addition the furniture was in pretty bad condition. Upholstery, ripped and hanging off the bottom of a bench and the table veneer severely damaged. We were then moved to a smoke-free room, but it also had a damaged table, as can be seen in this picture. Overall we found the room kind of depressing. Maybe it was the color, maybe the bare walls or the arrangement of the furniture--not sure. Also, don't order a cappuccino in the restaurant-it is steamed milk with regular coffee. One of our pet peeves is thermostats that do not work. We could not get the room above 68 degrees( it was chilly and damp out) and finally called the maintenance and he said the heat was turned off because people at a party complained it was too hot. It never reached our desired temperature. The positives were the staff was very nice, and it was a very comfortable bed. Not sure I would stay here again. Needs some remodeling, first.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant spot in downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Bondsammax
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night for business in March. The location is good at the far end of the inner Harbor, but not overly close to the crowds. The hotel is elegant & I had a nice room with Harbor view. I dined in the lounge and was surprised by the nice live music and good food. All told a pleasant stay and an excellent price for the product. In my case it was cheaper than the official hotel of the meeting where my colleagues stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend at the Intercontinental in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: kelley123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental in Baltimore with a couple of friends and had a fantastic time! The staff is amazing and go above and beyond to make you happy and comfortable. Make sure to visit the restaurant and bar! The room was exactly what we needed and the beds were perfect. The hotel is in a great location- right by the harbor for daytime activities and restaurants and bars to enjoy the nightlife. I would definitely suggest the Intercontinental for anyone traveling to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseCleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I were meeting up in Baltimore for a little get together reunion type thing. Intercontinental provided us with just the right atmosphere we were looking for. Elegant and relaxing at the same time. One of my girlfriends didn't want to leave her room. The food was delicious in the restaurant. We even ended up staying at the bar in the lobby instead of going out one night because we were so impressed with the service. I defiantly recommend Intercontinental Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: perryfamilyAZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, but is need of a refurbishment. The room was clean, but the bed was horrible! I stayed here 2 nights for a conference and the hotel staff was friendly, but tried too hard, this place isn't the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great beds”
Reviews.Author: Lobomojo
Reviews.Content: Despite getting a great deal on Priceline for 2 rooms, we were given two quite big and very clean rooms with views of downtown and partial harbor The beds and bedding were absolutely fantastic, just melted into sleep. The only "needs improvement" is to become more technology friendly, you really do need your own surge strip if you want to plug in more than one item. Service mostly exceptional. The bell lady was very prompt and informative. Violetta checked us in and out and was fantastic, immediately we felt special and welcomed. Also huge thanks and recognition to Sherry at breakfast, who was warm, friendly and provided great service. The breakfasts were very good and very reasonable for a hotel of this type. Jennifer at the bar was amazing and they have a great happy hour deal, (though the service suffered greatly on Jennifer's off nights and the web site is out of date - cigars no longer allowed) The health club and pool was remodeled, opened when we were there after closed our first two days, and is very nice with plenty of equipment and a clean and beautiful indoor pool ad Jacuzzi. Loved this hotel and will be first on the list next trip to Baltimore (p.s. we parked at the self parking, which was very convenient, not ideal price at $26/day in/out but about the same as anywhere else in the harbor and have to drive but Jack's Bistro in Canton , Sascha's by the Walters and the restaurant at the Baltimore Museum were all exceptional )

Reviews.Title: “wonderful wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl99
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by someone opening the car door as I arrived and then there was prompt service at the front desk. The housestaff is friendly and prompt. Everything was very clean. The room was very large with a desk, flat screen TV in the room, table, chairs and spacious. A pleasant surprise was the smaller flat screen TV in the bathroom! More than the average minor amenities were provided including shower cap, hygeine bags and more. The coffee/teas selection was my favorite. They have an individual brewer with Green mountain coffee and English tea. There is also a safe deposit box inconspicuously placed in the closet. There are down feather beds on the mattresses too. Also, the fitness center was great. There are just about every machine you could want, an indoor pool, large clean hot tub, racket ball court, tennis court, area to walk on the roof, sauna, and spa which were very nice. Overall, it was above and beyond what I expected. The only problem was that internet costs $13 a day, which I find an inconvenience. Also, the people staying here were mainly over 65 so I wouldn't come looking to meet someone in the hotel bar. Also, you are very close to all the inner harbor restaurants and attractions - within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pharmgal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We thought the hotel is decorated in a beautiful manner, and loved the paintings, fresh flowers, library, etc. We were disappointed that the pool wasn't open yet as that was one of the reasons we picked this place. The staff was friendly and accommodating , but be warned-take your own water and drinks as theirs are very expensive. I only wanted a ginger ale and the only way of getting it was from room service, as our refrigerator had some kind of lock requiring a key.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, service only so-so”
Reviews.Author: jk555
Reviews.Content: We recently got married and the wedding was out of town, so we had a reception in Baltimore when we came back to celebrate with our friends and family who couldn't make it. My husband and I stayed in this hotel and so did a couple of our friends who were in for the party. Both of us checked in after the hotel's check-in time and were told our rooms were not ready because so many people had received a late check-out from the night before (which was New Year's Eve). The person who checked my husband and I in was not apologetic at all, even when we explained that we had an event that night and we needed a room so that we could begin getting ready as we still had a few things we needed to get done before the party started. The only explanation we received was that so many people had a late check-out from New Year's Eve and we were assured we would be offered the same thing. We explained that we really did not have time to wait for a room to become available because we were throwing an event that evening they initially offered us a worse room than we had requested and paid for. We had paid for a king bed with a harbor view and were told our options were 2 double beds with a harbor view or a king bed with no harbor view. When we asked if we could get ready in one room and then move later on they were fine with that, but we felt that this is something they could have offered us initially. We thought maybe we should have told them that we had just gotten married, but I feel that a hotel like this that is supposed to be very nice and is pretty pricey should have been a little more apologetic about their screw-up. At the majority of nice hotels I've stayed at, I've never had a problem with check-in, even early check-ins are often accommodated, so I thought it was ridiculous for a room not to be ready over a half hour after their printed check-in time. That being said, everything else was perfect. The view in our harbor view room was amazing, the rooms were clean and very nice. And we found that most of the staff was relatively helpful. We were especially impressed with the bellmen who were always wiling to help out and were very friendly. Room service was also pretty good. And it's walking distance from all the shops, restaurants and other attractions in the inner harbor. Even with the initial problem I would probably stay again, particularly for the view. At the same time, there are a lot of really nice hotels in Baltimore, so I think Intercontinental really needs to step up their game if they want to remain competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: kunali
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in the Inner Harbour area. The rooms are very luxurious and spacious - they had a TV and phone in the bathroom! Most of them boast a beautiful view of the harbour and it is a walking distance from all the restaurants and shops as well as the baseball park. I stayed only for one night - but if I have to go back to Baltimore and stay longer - this would be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wonderful service ... the staff make it a very special place”
Reviews.Author: CleveRocks
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that it's a beautiful property in a great location, but what makes this place so wonderful is the staff. They seem genuinely invested in the guests feeling pampered and happy. And if they don't genuinely feel that way, then they are wonderful actors. EVERY SINGLE staffer I interacted with made me feel special, like all he/she cared about was my happiness, convenience and comfort. The front desk staff, the bellmen, the valets, the housekeepers, the indoor pool lifeguard, the nice lady in the coffee bar ... they made it a memorable and very very pleasant stay. I'd reserved what they call a "corner room" with a harbor view. I knew that it was 420 sq. ft., larger than their standard rooms. I'd anticipated that a corner room would have windows on 2 walls, but this did not. By corner room, they mean that the door to your room is in it's own tiny hallway off of the main hallway. There were two other doors in that tiny hallway, and both of them were to a suite that was the size of two such rooms. The hotel is quite wide, so it was a pretty long walk from the elevator all the way to a far corner of the hotel, but that's not a complaint ... more like a warning to anyone who has mobility issues but would think they want a corner room. The hallways were elegantly decorated with china cabinets and oil paintings of early American aristocrat types. You know, painting of a man in a powdered wig with his hunting dogs or his prized falcon, paintings of the hunt, and so on. The parking lot seemed inconveniently placed relative to the lobby and porte cochere, so I quickly changed from self-parking to valet parking. The indoor pool on the 7th floor was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. We were in town for a family event, and we wanted all of the rest of our time to be fun for the kids, so we needed the pool as well as the close proximity to the Inner Harbor. I can't say enough about how WONDERFUL the service was. It just about made up for the inflated price, but I guess the service was part of what I was paying for. Well, that and the second flat panel TV, which was located in the bathroom! THAT was a favorite of my 9 and 7 year olds.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett_AM
Reviews.Content: the stay was comfortable.. but single bed.. for 260 dollar room...i had never heard of it ..clean sheets, cozy bed, average bath... the toiletteries were really really bad. Tolerable..but expected much better for the price

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, dated decor”
Reviews.Author: SE-Explorer
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big, with comfy beds, work table, lots of lights, flat-screen TV with accessible video ports for using with own iPod, etc. Their in-house dry cleaning quickly and expertly cleaned my pants which had been stained in the luggage handling when some liquid burst during the flight. The work out facility is well equipped, but a bit crowded with so much stuff. Really only negative thing is the hotel decor is a bit dated and the air conditioning is asthmatic - I needed to leave it on all the time, even though the maids kept turning it off, for it to cool the room by bed-time.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: sonnyfrompa
Reviews.Content: Well first off the pics that depict the rooms you see when booking must be more pricey than the cramped little room I was given after forking over 250 bucks.......the bathroom in 330 is well the same color scheme as the one in the pic but wow lots smaller and well the tub somehow looked different when I got to my room.....go figure. Beware of the scam they have going on at the breakfast buffet. In the lobby it's advertised like 15,99 for the buffet but when you get your bill you will find out the 15.99 covers the fruit you eat but if you have a hot egg or a hot piece of toast or a hot sausage link they tack another 8 bucks to your bill.......guess its something like a trucking company charges you a fuel surcharge I dunno but I wont be going back ever again, Its not the prices I just dont like being misled.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler314
Reviews.Content: We could not be more pleased with our stay at the Intercontinental Harbor Court. Our reservations were for a corner room with a harbor view for four nights over Labor Day weekend. Upon arriving at 1:30 p.m. (check-in is at 3:30 p.m.), we were informed that our room was not ready and that we would be called when our room became available. The hotel staff secured our luggage and we made our way to the Inner Harbor to enjoy a couple of hours in the sun. We returned to the Harbor Court a little after 3:30 p.m. and were informed that our room had been upgraded. Indeed it was, to a corner harbor view suite. Our suite was beautiful and clean, the bed was very comfortable and we had great views of the Inner Harbor. The staff at the Harbor Court was very courteous and knowledgeable. We went to Brightons (located in the hotel) one morning for their breakfast buffet ($15 special). The food was very fresh and the service was great. I would definitely stay at the Harbor Court again. Make sure you get out of the Inner Harbor area. Take advantage of the punctual water taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: gazborangers
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at his great hotel. We hadn't booked a hotel in Baltimore and were given a great deal walking in off the street. Two opulently elegant adjoining rooms with attentive and friendly staff. A great location for all Inner Harbor attractions and a pitch away from Camden Yards home of the Baltimore Orioles. One thing I would say about Baltimore is just be sure you know where you are going as there does seem to be some unsavoury parts of the city. Overall a great stay and Intercontinental should be commended.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, nice location close to National Aquarium toilet seat damaged”
Reviews.Author: Travellingalligator
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good when it came to frienliness of the staff, the pool is fine and clean, all the facilities are nice, very calm location but still right at the harbour, great to walk to the National Aquarium and the restaurants there. Breakfast is expensive, thy have a small take out place though which was fine. The only complaint was the dmaged tolet seat in a suite the advertise as 550 $ a night. YOu jsut would not expect that. We only stayed one night to see the aquariu and i would do it again anytime. We (one child) basically did ot see any other guests - which was good in a way but don't expect anything lively!

Reviews.Title: “Overall positive experience”
Reviews.Author: TribecaChick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night while passing through Baltimore. As some other reviewers stated, the hotel is not new. While I wouldn't call it "old," I would say that a renovation should be in it's near future. We had a room with a king-sized bed and fantastic view of the inner harbor, the window was huge and we could see the whole harbor/waterfront. PROS: quick check-in, clean room, nice linens, flat panel TV CONS: expensive valet parking, older hotel - could use a renovation SIDE NOTE: We booked through our american express card and dinner & breakfast was included. For dinner - by the time we paid for tax, tip and drinks we felt that we should have just eaten where we wanted because the hotel restaurant is totally dead and awkwardly quiet. The food was ok, but we could have spent a few more bucks and eaten at a place of our choice in the harbor. The breakfast worked out well because they allow you to order room service and the room had a nice dining table and we were able to enjoy our view of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “In town for the Red Sox game...”
Reviews.Author: snoopydoo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a free night, so the value, for me, was of course, excellent. I would never pay their rates for a night in a hotel. The staff were very nice. They let us check in by noon (which was good because we were only there for one night, for a Red Sox game,and needed somewhere to put our luggage!) The room was very nice, but basic. I was happily surprised they had Krueig coffee makers in each room. The hotel location was very convenient for us, so we didn't have to rent a car (the parking cost would have negated the free night). Internet cost $, which we knew, so we didn't use that. We ate at the Hooters (which we could see from our room), didn't eat at the hotel. All in all, it was a very good "free night" stay, didn't feel like we were treated as a "free night", which was nice. I would recommend this hotel if you have any free nights.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for stealing my stuff!”
Reviews.Author: heartdoc1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outrageous -- outrageously bad. I had a phone charger and an iPod stolen from my room. When I contacted hotel security and the hotel manager, I was told that nothing could be done since there was "no proof" the items had been stolen! Thank God they didn't steal my laptop computer, as well -- I guess I would have had no proof of that either! Housekeeping staff actually went through my laptop bag to find my iPod and probably thought the phone charger was the iPod charger! Even though hotel has an electronic key lock system which lets them identify exactly which employee was the only one to enter the room, they still refused to take any action!!! Why stay where thieves are harbored and protected??? Not me, never again! Fitness center was extremely mediocre, as well...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for the 4th of July!”
Reviews.Author: nwlilac
Reviews.Content: The location and the harbor view rooms cannot be beat! We loved watching the 4th of July fireworks from our room! The package was a good deal, because it included breakfast, valet parking and tickets to the National Aquarium. The room was spacious and comfortable. I'm glad I read the other reviews and learned that water in the room cost $5, because we brought our own beverages. The housekeeping service was inconsistent. Our group had three rooms and different complaints. They conserve water and energy by asking guests to re-use towels (which is fine), but two of the three rooms didn't receive all their towels to begin with. . . and had to ask for them more than once. There is a nice in-room coffee maker, but the supplies were never refreshed. One room had an iron that didn't work. They brought one that did, but didn't take or identify the broken one, so another guest is likely to run into the same problem. But despite those minor problems, we found much more that we liked about the hotel than we didn't - and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Once again we have enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: livinmydestiny
Reviews.Content: We visit last year for the 4th of July. (Our wedding anniversary) That year we brought our Son (8) and daughter (6). We even invited friends over to watch the fireworks with us. We had an awesome view. We ordered rooms serivice, the food was very good. Our children loved the T.V. in the bathroom. We told the hotel it was our anniversary and they left champagne and strawberries in our room. We enjoyed the pool and the hot tub. My 6 year old daughter was VERY impressed that she requested to have her 7th birthday there. We granted her request. She chose one friend and they had a GREAT time. The hotel left cookies in the room for her. When we ordered room service the attendant was sweet and wished my daughter a happy birthday. We asked the concierge for candles, he provided a few that were pretty beat up and very dirty, nothing I would put in her birthday cake. The request was made very late at night and I should not have forgotten her candles. Lastly, we brought our Yorkie with us, he stayed in the car overnight and the Valet walked him in the morning, we were very thankful to him. We enjoyed our stay yet again and would come back again and again. Thank you all for an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Break From the Inner Harbor Chains”
Reviews.Author: dougiefreshpdx
Reviews.Content: As someone who goes to the Inner Harbor area at least three times a year on business, I am pretty tired of the Hilton/Sheraton/Marriott/etc. major chains. I decided to reward myself on my last trip and splurge for a room at the Harbor Court, especially as I couldn't get a good deal on any of the generics. The public areas at the Harbor Court are lovely and I really enjoyed eating my first night at the Bar; excellent food, good drinks and nice service. The room I got was nothing special but the linens were high quality and the bed was very comfortable. A few small complaints: for $350 night per night I'd like a newspaper delivered to my door and free coffee in the lobby is always a nice way to start the day. BY the standards of the Inner Harbor this is by far the nicest place to stay and I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “this is not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobcat123
Reviews.Content: this place is well below average at a price well above average. a friend and i stayed here in June and the AC didn't work in either of our rooms. his room had a leaking toilet so he had to be moved. the fitness center is pathetic. i called for ice and it arrived 1 hour and 10 minutes later. we arrived at about 1:00 a.m. and had to wait almost 20 minutes before we could check in because the front desk attendant was missing in action. i'll never return.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: onthegoer26
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 yr old daughter and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend so we could spend time in the Inner Harbor. The location was great but the hotel had many quality issues that would make us select a different hotel for future trips. Briefly: Downsides: - rooms and furniture are worn, a bit scuffed and design is dated. - breakfast was understaffed and buffet options were limited. Syrup was left over a super hot sterno so it turned to stringy caramel. Not pleasant. Food ran low as it was quite crowded and was not replenished and seating was limited. - overall front desk service was spotty -- some people were helpful and professional; some were inattentive; and others had poor suggestions for restaurant recommendations. - pool is quite small and while there was a lifeguard on duty, she paid no attention to kids in the pool. One child sank under the water and was struggling, starting to drown. His uncle jumped into the pool quickly to rescue him and the lifeguard, unaware of the child, yelled at the man for jumping into the pool. Withering looks and comments from all of us adults present did not seem to perk up her attentiveness. On the positive side: - The bed was very comfortable and the rooms quiet. - The Aquarium package included tickets that use the membership entrance so there was no delay and no waiting on long lines. - The location was terrific as we visited both the Visionary Art Museum/Federal Hill and the Aquarium. - Parking was hassle free as valet parking was included in the package too.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay”
Reviews.Author: MrsTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 7-year-old and I spent Memorial Day weekend 2009 at the InterContinental in Baltimore. The hotel's decor is not quite our style. We prefer modern. That's of course a personal preference. Last year, I stayed at another nearby hotel. I much preferred the other hotel... more our style.. and a bit more centrally located to the Inner Harbor. Check-in was an easy affair. We were able to get into our room early (1:30pm). We got the King bed we asked for. We did not request a specific view but we were given one with a nice view of the Inner Harbor. Our room was on the 8th floor (top floor). Our son loved the small flat screen television in the bathroom. We had breakfast at the hotel once. The dining room is small. There weren't that many people there but the waitresses seemed overwhelmed. We skipped the buffet and ordered from the menu. Our son had the scrambled eggs, my husband and I had eggs sunny side up. It took awhile for our food to come, but it was good. It took a couple of requests to get a refill of apple juice. Our bill came to $43. My husband gave $60. The waitress came back and said "Can I just give you $6 back? If not, I have to go downstairs to get change." My husband said "Um.. no.. I gave you $60." She apologized profusely. So we had to wait for the change. We were not impressed. We also ordered room service once and a part of the order was wrong. Our son had the peanut butter and jelly sandwich with fries. He seemed to like it. My husband had the chicken sandwich (overcooked) and the chocolate mousse (just okay). I only had the cheesecake (very blah). My husband and our son spent a couple of hours at the pool. It is not that big and if a lot of people are there, it could easily get crowded. Overall, this hotel was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: EarlyBuyer
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. Parking was higher than expected, however that's the going rate for downtown. Enjoyed being able to walk to so many shopping and dinning options after the work day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location comes at a price”
Reviews.Author: ValueEquation
Reviews.Content: Great location at the Inner Harbor. The people at the hotel deliver great service and are very helpful. Concierge service was good and the desk was great at additional requests and questions. Very nice room for two parents with a big teen son (sofa bed for him). The place seems to be holding it's own when compared to our visit several years back. Be sure to ask for rates such as AAA, a rate associated with a convention or a group you may be traveling with, etc. Did not eat at the hotel this trip. All in all, worth the money and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were rude and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: LifeonVacation
Reviews.Content: The treatment at the front desk was right out of Pretty Woman. The lifeguard at the pool kept picking on this little kid in the pool until we were about ready to toss water on her laptop. Two bath towels in the room. Room service left no condiments for the dry toast. We had a great experience at the Mayflower in Washington DC and Loews in Philadelpia. Consider going there instead!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular room...superior staff!”
Reviews.Author: Magellan3
Reviews.Content: I noticed that some past reviews were on the less positive side, but my stay was exceptional! Apparently, a lot has changed since past reports. Maybe, they hired the right person for the job. For my initial reservation, I requested a non-smoking two queen bed room with a view, but upon arrival I was informed that there were no rooms available that met my preference. Because of the error, the front desk representative was apologetic and was quickly making arrangements to find a suitable upgraded room. It was late and I was a bit tired, but never felt that there was a problem and knew that the representative was doing everything possible to make my visit pleasurable. On this day, the only rooms available were corner suites, but she didn’t hesitate to grant me the major upgrade. The suite was beautiful and equipped with two bathrooms (one with a TV), a plush king size bed, a wall flip-down queen, living and dining areas, and a large flat screen TV. The room was exceptionally clean too. I find it rather rare these days to find hotel staff that go the extra mile, but that day they did just that. I was also happy to notify the hotel manager and InterContinental corporate office of the excellent customer service I received. She recognized a problem, and quickly corrected it above and beyond. I hope she received an award, because it was well deserved! Every once in a while I find exceptional service, and when I do…I tell someone. Ironically, during the same vacation at another hotel, a similar situation occurred and instead placed me in a smoking room, even though I mentioned that I was sensitive to smoke. I guess you can’t win the all, but I would definitely return to the InterContinental Harbor Court Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, best hotel restaurant I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: rachaar
Reviews.Content: We had a multi-generational spa trip with myself, my mother, my grandmother, and my brother's soon-to-be wife, and stayed at the Intercontinental on a package deal my father got through his American Express card. The hotel is really lovely; our harborview rooms were absolutely amazing, other than the fact that the thermostat seemed disinclined to function properly and the room was always hot. The rooftop fitness center is surprisingly well-appointed; I'm just sorry I couldn't roll myself out of bed early enough to take advantage of the free yoga classes they offer guests. The real highlight is the hotel's restaurant and lounge. We had breakfasts and one dinner at the hotel as part of the package deal. We went to the M&S on the harbor for dinner on Friday night and were completely underwhelmed, and my experience with hotel restaurants has never exactly been positive, so I resigned myself to having lousy culinary experiences all weekend. Breakfast on Saturday morning was an absolute eye-opener. The prices are what you would expect for this class of hotel, but the portions were incredibly generous and really superb. I had Greek yogurt and an incredibly oversized bagel sandwich and couldn't even eat again until dinner; the fresh berries my mother got were plentiful and perfectly ripe, and the waffles and croissants enjoyed by others at the table were superb. On Sunday morning we were brought toast free of charge just because we asked nicely. Our waitress was friendly and remembered us from Saturday, asking about how our spa date went and keeping our coffee cups full. My grandmother fell in love with a dashing young Dutch man named Joas who kept up with our water and orange juice and rescued my mother's napkin from the floor, and was entirely friendly, charming, and delightful. Dinner on Saturday night was AMAZING. Our waiter had a quick, dry sense of humor and kept us laughing all night; the bar invented a drink for me called the "picky guest" after I didn't like the cocktail menu; the lobster bisque my grandmother was the only one to have the nerve to order was so wonderful we sopped up every last bit of it with bread from the table and were fighting each other for the right to sample from my grandmother's bowl. The executive chef, an enormous mountain of a man nicknamed Zeus, came out to say hello and could not have been more wonderful - he told us the secret of the bisque is cognac and seemed more than happy to share the full recipe with us. Our entrees were fantastic, especially considering that they were the same price point as the place we had gone on Friday and been so sorely disappointed - the veal marsala is particularly wonderful. And Zeus came out with a plate of little bite-sized desserts for us, no doubt because my grandmother was busy charming everyone she could find. We were so impressed with everyone. And finally, in the lounge, we spent several happy minutes chatting with the wonderful pianist, who had sat down to play when I was in the middle of a ranting story about work and was careful not to overwhelm my yelling with his music (as he admitted to us when we started to talk). He was just the nicest guy as well as being a great musician. I know this appears to be more of a restaurant review, but mostly, we thought everyone we dealt with at the hotel on every level was just amazing, very professional and friendly. I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor Court - Beautiful in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: auntbuff
Reviews.Content: Incredible inside - lobby is amazing, the hallways are intriguing (you can get lost in the corridors, but it is fascinating walk, interesting paintings, lovely furniture.) Rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated, some of the harbor view rooms have a bay area that provides a very romantic setting for a room service dinner. The hotel is very conveniently located, not only to Inner Harbor sites but to Federal Hill and other downtown areas. Water taxi stops across the street, you can easily get to Little Italy, Fells Point and more. The rooms were amazingly quiet, especially for a downtown hotel. A friend stayed here for one night in October, 2008 and another for several in October 2007. This hotel has character, the staff is as fantastic as the property.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler003
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed here while we were visiting Johns Hopkins on a college tour. All I can say is save your money and stay somewhere else. I can't recommend any other hotels in Baltimore, but as I recall the Hyatt and Marriotts were much cheaper than the Intercontinental (there's not a Ritz or Four Seasons). From the moment we checked in until we checked out, it was a complete disaster. The person who checked us in was incredibly rude and gave us two rooms on either side of the service elevator even though the hotel wasn't full! (So of course we had to listen to the banging and clanging all night.) The other person at the front desk gave us wrong directions to a restaurant that was about a block away! The room reminded me of an extremely cheap low budget hotel; the carpet was some cheap velour-type of fabric, the bedding was gross, the AC didn't work well, the bed was missing a finial (it sounds minor, but gave the room an incredibly "dilapidated" feel), cheesey art work, etc., etc. On the positive side, the bathroom was quite nice. The next morning we had breakfast in the restaurant and the buffet was pathetic; they had these tiny little pastries that looked like something a child would make in an Easybake Oven, but perhaps the worst part was the museli had turned sour and tasted like stale milk. We really couldn't wait to get out of there, but of course to top it all off, we were charged for parking that was included in our room rate. So, like I say, save your money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I'd call 5-star”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoaster1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in August and were looking for some serious luxury as well as a convenient location. The front-desk staff was great from check-in to check-out, but we felt the hotel just lacked the general attitude and feeling you would expect from a five-star hotel. The room, while very spacious, was tired and in need of renovation. The flat-screen in the bathroom is a nice touch but didn't make up for the dated decor. Additionally, the room felt slightly damp, no matter how high we ran the air conditioner. The repairman, who arrived very promptly, told us there wasn't much we could do about it. Two other service calls we made were not addressed until we called again. We had ordered a crib which, when it was finally delivered, was too small. The business center is a joke and the gym was too small for all the equipment in it, but the pool and patio area was very nice. We didn't eat at the hotel at all. As I said, the front desk staff was faultless, but the doormen were a bit erratic, either running to help or sitting by and watching me struggle with toddler, bags and stroller. All in all, this was not the luxury stay we had been hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: BrandonK
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine at check-in. The valet was prompt and there was a doorman present. The room was nice, although I was hoping for a view of the harbor; instead we got a view of other rooms. We only stayed one night; apparently there was a wedding party staying in the room next to us. It sounded like there was a frat house next door. We called and complained and security was supposedly going to make a second trip up to the room. The noise quited down shortly after that (2:00 am). Unfortunately, it was only temporary. At about 4:00 am we were awoken by the sound of bodies slamming into walls and glass breaking and drunk men shouting. I have no idea what was going on in that room but it didn't sound good. We made another attempt to call and complain, but this time no one answered. We called the front desk, the concierge, and even room service and no one picked up. At checkout, they didn't even ask how my stay was. I complained about the noise and how no one would answer the phones, and the response I got was "Oh, I'm sorry about that. We'll have to look into that."

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable & Competitively Priced”
Reviews.Author: TommyGlenmoore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for our anniversary over Labor Day. We tried to get into Henderson's Wharf however they were demanding 3 day reservations and we didn't have that much time. Renaissance rates were sky-high but we managed to get a view room at the Intercontinental at an advance rate of $270/night (plus taxes which jumped it to slightly over $300). Front desk was efficient upon arrival and the concierge tipped us off to a complimentary limo service pick-up that was provided by the restaurant we had reservations at (Kali's Court - see our review). Room was clean, extremely spacious and had a great view of the Inner Harbor. Bathroom similarly luxurious and with it's own flat screen as previous reviewer noted.
