Parking is a bit steep at $17/day self park. All in all, an extremely pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view and Huge room”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Got this room via priceline for a great rate at the last second and still ended up with a huge room and great view. Flat screen tv's in both bathroom and the bedroom, and quite clean overall. Location was great across the street from the Science museum at the end of the inner harbour. Parking prices were about the norm for the area of baltimore at $17 per 24 hours and check-in was efficient. The hotel has an impressive overall atmosphere and no complaints as there were no problems.

Reviews.Title: “great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennmelzer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Excellent service, clean, comfortable rooms and location, location, location! You are right across the street from the inner harbor which provides great choices of shopping, eating and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment - Won't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: travelwithkids_7
Reviews.Content: While the lobby impressed, it was all down hill after that. The room smelled musty, the carpet was somewhat damp and the bathroom was decaying (toilet seat was all chipped up). Room service was slow and didn't have all the items we wanted. Contacting anyone was slow. The worst part was the night. There was a train going by that rumbled the room every 5 minutes or so. We had the worst sleep there. The last time we went to Baltimore, the Intercontinental was sold out, so we had to settle for the Hyatt, but after staying at both, we will be trading UP to the Hyatt from now on. What a let down for a hotel chain that we've always enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Some good to say, but more bad”
Reviews.Author: Retiredjeff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel overnight for an Orioles game. We had a courtyard room and though the decor was a bit dark and tired (needs updating), the room itself was nicely sized and so was the bathroom. On arrival one light in the bathroom was out. This hotel looks as though it needs a thorough cleaning. Nearly every door on our floor was severely marred on the bottom one foot from shoes, carts or whatever. Looked horrible. Stains on the curtains in our room also. Breakfast was good, but when they ask if you want coffee and juice, be careful -- the small glass of juice cost $4.50! The restaurant used for breakfast also needed some deep cleaning. We sat next to the windows - unfortunately we had to look at the air vents at the bottom of the windows and they were totally littered with dust, small dirt and other stuff. Just did not look clean and made you wonder how clean the other places were that were out of public view. Small hair found underneath the scrambled eggs after my wife ate half of them. The hotel took off the cost of the meal, as they should have. I would not recommend this hotel -- there are too many others that are newer, cleaner and doing a better job. The owners need to invest in this hotel if they want to keep up -- needs updating and cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: 123NewYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best view of the inner harbor one can find. The minute you walk into the hotel you can tell this is a special place. I was assigned an upgraded view room due to my platinum status. I must of by luck been assigned the one room that was not up to par (some issues). Without asking I was moved to a huge mini suite and the room I left was placed out of order. Once you walk in and see this hotel you will know my experience with a sup par room was not the norm. When in baltimore stay here, especially on weekends when it cost a few bucks more than the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “You'll feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: iloo
Reviews.Content: This is probably the nicest hotel to stay at in Baltimore. It is right on the inner harbor, has amazingly comfortable beds, and the staff is very helpful and welcoming. Special kudos to Joe and Preston, as well as the doormen Don and Luciano. The rooms are large and spacious, with well equipped bathrooms and clean, yet traditional and warm decor. We had our two children travelling with us and really felt at home. Don't try anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: Daoda2
Reviews.Content: I'd find it hard to believe there's a nicer hotel in Baltimore. The quality of the Intercontinental's is very variable, but this was one of the better. Old world, Ritz style (hunting dog paintings hanging in the halls and so on). Professional service, high quality rooms, great beds, Philips flat screen TV, good bathroom. The only limitation is that the desk and chair is designed for someone sending handwritten notes to Edith Wharton at The Mount. The desk is too high to work easily with a computer, and the chair has a straight, wood back which is comfortable for about 5 minutes. They need to redo the workstation area, but otherwise a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Izzynat
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was lovely. We had a very spacious Corner Suite with a beautiful veiw. We travel frequently and found that we really got our money' s worth. At $800/night we got a very large 1100 square foot room with 2 bathrooms, one with jacuzzi tub, 2 large bay windows overlooking the harbour, large bedroom, with french doors opening to a living room and dining area. The room was very clean, service was outstanding. We had cocktails in the Explorer lounge one evening.(very nice) Not one complaint. We will definatley be back. Also it is a quick cab ride to Johns Hopkins Hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location -- Short of expectation”
Reviews.Author: travelerscubed
Reviews.Content: The location of the IC Harbor Court is great! Within walking distance to the Inner Harbor, Baltimore Aquarium, The Power Co, and Camden Yards. My husband, 12 year-old son, and I booked a two night stay for a weekend vacation to see the Aquarium. I booked a package deal that included valet parking, breakfast for 2 (up to $20/pp), and 2 tickets for the aquarium. I was told that additional tickets could be purchased at the front desk upon arrival. Check-in was quick and pleasant. Our room was upgraded to a harbor view as a member of the Priority Club. The room was very nice: great view, clean bathroom, all plumbing and electronics working, well-kept furnishings, clean carpet, and fresh smelling. We ordered room service for breakfast the first morning. Almost everything was delivered as ordered. We ordered a glass of milk instead of juice. The milk was brought in a small cream pitcher. I called room-service. They misunderstood that this was milk for the coffee instead of a beverage. A large glass of milk was brought within 5 minutes of the call. I went to the front desk to purchase the additional aquarium ticket as I was told to do. I was informed that they had no more tickets. Too bad. Oh wait, they might have a child's ticket somewhere in the back. Fortunately, my son met the age requirement and they were able to find the additional ticket. Maid service knocked and entered the room as we were still preparing to leave for our outing. I told her we would be ready to leave in 15 minutes and could she come back then. Upon return from our days outing, around 8 p.m., the room was not made up and the breakfast tray with all the dirty dishes were still in the room. I called the front desk to request maid service. They said that I had refused service earlier in the day so my room was not made up. They asked if I wanted a full cleaning or just some fresh towels. I opted for the fresh towels. I was told I would have to call room service myself to arrange the for removal of the breakfast tray. Neither maid service nor room service showed up after an hour. Eventually, the turn down service knocked and was able to get us fresh towels and convinced room service to come for our breakfast trolley. The hotel has a very nice indoor pool which we all enjoyed. Pool towels are provided as were various floatation devices for the kids (noodles and kick boards). There are other gym ammenities but we did no use them. We did not eat in the restaurants or the small coffee shop in the lobby. Upon leaving, our bill was overstated for a few items that they readily took off. It's just annoying that they were there in the first place. One expects that from lower establishments, but not from an upper star hotel. The valet service to retrieve our luggage and car was quick and courteous. A nice hotel but too many things were "off" for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting night...”
Reviews.Author: edub75
Reviews.Content: Well, I was initially looking for a hotel to stay in since my friends and I would be out drinking all night, and driving back to NJ was not an option. We looked on line and I got hte room for $115 on Priceline, it was cheaper then staying at a Days Inn (gross). But normally the rates were $250 or higher a night. So getting there, I didnt think I would pay almost $20 to park overnight when valet was $21. The front desk guy was awesome, I accidently left my camera and he called my room and let me know. The TV in the bathroom didnt work, and the room didn't exactly look like the pictures on line. But still nice ,but not worth $250 a night. So we get in late that night and find our room. My bathroom was occupied by my friend so I went to look for one, a bell hop advised me that there was one on the 2nd floor and he took me there and back to my room, but then tried to hug me and I think he would have kissed me if I didnt turn away. Kind of freaked me out. but I got back to my room and then went to bed. Nice place if you like to make out w/ the help! Oh and the next morning I set my hair dryer down on the sink and the TV came on by itself. The FUJI water in the room was priced at $5...

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: hrhweezie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in February since I had a conference in the hotel. I had a conference rate of $249 + tax/night. I saw the rack rates and the place is very pricey. The hotel is a short $9 cab ride from Penn Station. The hotel is very lovely and the staff was friendly. I had a room on the 5th floor that overlooked the courtyard and other rooms - quite disappointing. But the room was huge, probably bigger than my apartment. I had 2 beds instead of a king, but that's ok. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was very good size and had a nice flat-screen TV in it. Robes were provided, but they weren't very comfortable - for the amount the room costs - they could have gotten a softer material. A hairdryer is also provided, but is very disappointing. Bring your own. it was a cheap model that only worked on low so it took 30 minutes to dry my shoulder length hair. Again, for the price paid - they could have upgraded the quality at minimum cost. My first night - I arrived late and had room service for dinner. it was good, but as all room service is - pricey. I also ate the meals during the conference and lunch was excellent. They had a wonderful variety of fresh veggies. The location is fantastic. The hotel is right across the street from the Inner Harbor and the USS Constellation. We got lucky on Wednesday with a 60 degree day so were ableto walk around the harbor before dinner. I am sure int he summertime that this location can't be beat! Overall, I would stay there again if I got a great rate. I don't think any hotel is worth the rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Would Come Back Again”
Reviews.Author: toto4712
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!!!!! The door man was very nice. The young black girl who check me in made me feel like I was a nobody. She did not give me any infomation about the area. Just only was looking at the computer srceen. Hotel room was very nice just the only thing the doors on the 4th floor were being work on and for a $300 night stay I would think the door should look alot better. Also about 9am housekeeping came into my room without knocking on the door. But overall nice hotel great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Thanks to the Staff”
Reviews.Author: Buzliteyear
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the InterContinental Harbor Court Baltimore over a long weekend during the last week of November, 2007. With the wife and 2 kids, we went to Inner Harbor for a mini vacation. THE GOOD Great hotel, great staff, great service, great room, etc. I could go on. ICHC is definitely worthy of the 5 Star Rating. The hotel overlooks the Inner Harbor and is right across the street from the Science Center. Everything was exceptional. It was the rank and file staff that really made the trip great and the hotel experience tremendous. When we first arrived and entered the lobby, I was searching for a garbage can to discard a beverage when "Sir, I'll take that for you." One of the employees noticed that I was looking for the garbage and just offered to take it himself. Nice touch. THE BAD Our only complaint was this: we had just returned to our room about noon to find one of the cleaning staff getting ready to do the room. She offered to come back since we had just returned. We agreed, showered and changed, and left. She never returned, so our room wasn't redone. ALL IN ALL Top of the heap InterContinental. Thanks for the great weekend, and don't change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel near the inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: FrisbieCat
Reviews.Content: I agree with the last reviewer who wondered about previous negative reviews. Boy, some of those reviews are downright mean, sometimes based on an isolated negative experience with one person or relatively minor issue. Relax, people; not all travel experiences are going to be flawless from beginning to end. I also can't help but wonder if the personality (e.g. rude or demaning behavior) of patrons has something to do with the way they are treated by staff. But I digress. I found this to be a perfectly pleasant hotel. The hotel is well located just across the street from the inner harbor (I would point out, though, that the "street" is an ugly, busy, eight-lane monstrosity, so it's not exactly a leisurely stroll to the water). You can easily walk to all major downtown attractions. The lobby is attractive, I found the staff to be helpful (for example, they were all too willing to let us check in a few hours early), and our rooms was clean, elegant, and quiet. We splurged a bit for a small suite on an upper floor, and would recommend that. We had a terrific panoramic view of the harbor, but it's not a tall hotel so only the top couple floors have really striking views. Our room had a large HD tv, a separate tv in the bathroom, enormous tub and shower, canopy bed, and sitting area. I am very sensitive to noise, and the hotel was quiet; you could hear the typical door and low voice once in awhile, but nothing too disruptive. We took a peak at the fitness center, and were impressed to see an outdoor rooptop tennis court, raquet ball court, decent-sized pool, and ample fitness equipment. We didn't have to deal with parking and didn't eat in the hotel so we can't judge those experiences. Overall, you may not have a five-star, flawless experience, but chances are very good you'll have a relaxing, very comfortable stay in a very nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. I just didn't experience what others complained about.”
Reviews.Author: CoastalSailor
Reviews.Content: After booking the room and then reading the reviews, which I normally do in reverse, I was a little hesitant about staying there for 5 days. However, the room (standard courtyard view) was in excellent condition from the gold bathroom fixtures to the flat screen tv's, carpets, and furniture. The only thing that was surprising was the styrofoam cups for the tea/coffee service in the room. Before leaving home I added a night to my stay through their 800 number, and was told it was the last room. Upon arrival I was so busy checking in that I didn't notice that my check out day was incorrect. I was not aware of this until the day before my departure when I found my bill under the door. I called the front desk the clerk told me they expected me to check out given they were full. I left a message asking them to call me given I was working at the convention center. The hospitality manager looked into the issue and found that the front desk clerk had not reviewed the date of departure and that he had already fixed the problem, had spoken with the clerk, and reassured me not to worry any longer. He could easily have made my life miserable considering the inavailability of rooms and it was my word against theirs. I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms were quiet, perfectly white glove clean, and in much better condition than the Reinissance Inner Harbor which was pricier and shabbier in comparison. The staff was very nice, very accommodating, and completely professional.

Reviews.Title: “My room was FREE and I WOULD NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sweetlady79
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night and had to wait 20 minutes just to get inside the courtyard only to wait another 5 minutes before flagging down the only valet/bellhop. He told me that he was busy but I could "self-park" if I wanted and gave me directions to the self-parking area. After going to the garage and discovering the I had to check-in before I could gain access to the garage, I then return to wait another 15 minutes to get into the courtyard. I parked my car and went inside to check-in. After check-in (3 min) I returned to the courtyard to meet the valet/bellman who says he needs me to move my car so that he can get someone else's car through. After resisting the urge to scream I then proceeded to unload my bags from the car only to have bellman/valet finally offer to take my bags up "in a few minutes". I was hesitant to leave my belongings in that courtyard and decided after initially taking my carryon up to the room to go retrieve my luggage. I didn't see the bellman anymore. I needed a bigger safe to store my belongings so I went to the front desk to ask if they could store my property in a vault. The front desk rep gave me an unassuring response and after he opened every drawer behind the counter in a "why are you bothering me tonite-manner" he told me that they (the hotel) installed those safes in the room so that the customers......and then his voice trailed. I got the message and decided to take my property back to my room and "try" to make it fit in the safe. To be honest, what I had on my person should not have been in my room unattended for the safety and security of the public and I decided to stay in my room with it than go out and enjoy the surrounding area. I was only in Baltimore for two nights and I guarantee that the next time I stay in Baltimore, it will not be at the Intercontinental Harbor. That hotel is a waste of money even if it wasn't my personal money that was being spent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Inner Harbor Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kueric09
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to the InterContinental Harbor Court. There isn't a better location on the Inner Harbor, at the end of all of Inner Harbor shops and restaurants, essentially across the street from the aquarium and very close to the stadiums. But what made it so great is the fact that despite being so close, it was in the middle of it all without being next door. So it was secluded enough to enjoy the luxurious accommodations and service at the InterContinental. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, business and pleasure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mediocre, But At 5 Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: BaltoMan52
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a Saturday night at the Intercontinental. We live only a few blocks from the hotel, but we had a $500 gift certificate so we thought we'd spend the night and have a nice dinner. Valet parking is easy and check in is fast and uncomplicated. I don't think the hotel has any other parking, so if you drive you will be paying $29 for valet parking. Our room rate was $319 for a harbor view room. That was with an AARP discount. This seemed kind of high for a weekend night, but what the heck, we had a gift certificate. The room was comfortable although it is starting to look a bit dated. The king size bed was comfortable, but not anything special. The view of the Inner Harbor is great. The pay per view did not work on our tv, but was fixed in about 10 minutes after a phone call to the front desk. There was no mouthwash in the bathroom. On the way back to our room after dinner, we ran into someone who appeared to be a high priced hooker, high on something, roaming the hall in her barefeet with an icebucket in her hand, looking for a an ice machine . I'm not sure if she ever found one. Much to our disappointment, Hampton's Restaurant in the hotel is no longer open. Although the restaurant was always over priced, we have had a couple of good meals there in the past and were looking forward to dinner there especially on a gift certificate. We made reservations at Brighton's Restaurant which is also in the hotel. I had the grouper and my girlfriend had the swordfish, both were edible, but for a dinner tab including a couple of cocktails each of $140 without tip, I expected a little more. I have had better in meals in Fells Point bars for about 1/3 of the cost. There were only 4 other couples in the restaurant and we were the only diners after about 9:00 pm. The following morning, I made some coffee on the machine in the room, but there were no mugs, so I put it in a glass. There was only one serving of unflavored coffee, so I ordered a pot of coffee from room service, which was close to $20 including, tip and delivery charge. They brought two cups, one of which looked like it had been put through the dishwasher with a paper napkin on it and then dried. The resulting caked on white stuff was pretty awful . I called the front desk to tell them that one of the cups had some foreigh matter stuck to it and he told me that "that does not live up to the level of service we try to provide". I thought "OK, so do I get a clean cup or what?" None ever arrived. The coffee was ok which I drank from the other cup. When we checked out, I told the desk person about the cup and they kind of looked at me strangely. The one clerk told the other to take the charge off our bill. I told them I drank the coffee and was ok paying for it, but thought they might be interested to know that room service is sending their guests cups with yukky white stuff on it. Anyway, all told we had to put another $70 on top of the $500 gift certificate to cover dinner, a pay per view movie, and a night at the hotel. I travel a lot on business and the service at this hotel does not even meet the level one can expect from any Marriott anywhere in the US. Bottom line - nothing about the service, the rooms, or food in this hotel is anything other than very average. But the prices are way above average.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: taniaw
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline for $109, and, I must say, I really enjoyed my stay. Valet parking was quick and easy. Check-in was friendly and efficient. The lobby was beautiful, and I absolutely loved my room! I was on the same floor as the fitness center, with a view of the courtyard. My room had an extremely comfortable King Size bed, a nice seating area, and a big widescreen TV. And it was a lot bigger than I anticipated. The coffee maker was a little unusual - I actually had to read the instructions in order to figure it out! It also came with several different flavors of coffee and also with tea which was nice. Good choices and expected prices in the honor bar. Complimentary robes in the closet for use during the stay. The bathroom was huge - it had a nice selection of toiletries, and another flat screen TV with remote. The elevators worked well -I never had to wait very long. Checkout was easy, and my car was ready when I needed it. I didn't use the restaurant or the bar. The Inner Harbor was right across the street, which was great. All in all, I felt that this was a great hotel in the Inner Harbor, and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ANDYH428
Reviews.Content: Booked the Intercontinental through priceline for $99 a night. We arrived to a great entrance where our doorman was awaiting and helped us take our suitcases out of the cab and into the lobby. Very quick check in, we stayed in room 541 which has a view of the garden. We didn't use the pool but it seems very nice. We were in town for only 2 days so we didn't eat at the hotel since we were at the harbor enjoying the many options to eat (cheesecake factory,phillips,california pizza kitchen,hard rock to name a few). We definitely recommend Phillips for a true Baltimore feel. Great seafood and if you order the 20 oz beer you get a great souvenir beer glass. The hotel was very nice inside...very elegant, nice lobby and clean hallways and elevator. The room was alot bigger than what we were expecting. It doesn't feel like a hotel room , more like a nice bedroom with a soft rug,great flat 27" lcd hdtv,big comfy bed with tons of pillows, a table in the room with chairs and a big bathroom with a tv in it. Definitely going to stay again in the near future! Miss the crab cakes already.

Reviews.Title: “All the charm of a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from room 516 of the Intercontinental Inner Harbor. This hotel pretends to be premier but since it's now owned by the Holiday Inn company, be warned that it acts a lot like it. Some facts: The hotel advertises two restaurants and a bar. Don't believe. it. It has one restaurant open. Period. The bar areas is covered by plastic sheeting and no one will tell us when it might reopen. Noise. If you have a Harborview room, get ready for it. At 4:20 a.m. this morning, the music was blaring across the street at the Inner Harbor Park and I called the front desk to ask how long it might be going on. "I don't hear it," the agent said. "But it will probably stop soon." It didn't. One final note, When we checked in, we had to lug our bags from the cab in to the lobby because no bellman was present. I left them in the lobby because the woman checking me in assured me that she would have them sent up to my room "as soon as I can find someone". After waiting 45 minutes, I went back down to the lobby only to spot the bellman putting my bags in the back of a departing taxi. Yep, this place is great on service. Save your money - or even more important, send this place a message that sloppy service is going to result in more vacant rooms. I am out of here in three hours. Headed to the Hyatt down the street for the rest of my stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TXWV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location for touring the Inner Harbor. It is right across the street from all the major activity, yet not too close that you are bothered by noise. The rooms are very nice and the beds are super comfy. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful and even allowed me to check in at noon since I arrived to town early. The only drawback was the parking- super high! But, if you want to see all that the inner harbor has to offer, I would highly recommend. If you are eating out: avoid the Rusty Scupper. HORRIBLE SERVICE. Our meal was very expensive and not that tasty. Our waiter left us mid-way through the meal and never returned. I would highly recommend Legal Seafoods. Price and service great- food- above excellent!

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental "Horror" Court”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyScubaGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Baltimore every year for the past six years. We now have a three-year-old son who accompanies us and we usually stay at another property. Anyway, I have stayed at other InterContinental properties over the past seven years for business trips so I thought we should give it a try in Baltimore. The prices are a bit steep for a family weekend but we thought it would be worth it. Well, we were wrong. Not one valet to be found when we arrived. The check-in AND check-out staff member was rude. We were juggling our bags, the three-year-old, a stroller and toys...so much for five-star-service. Our room did have a nice Harbor view but that is all I can say for the price. The room looked like something out of a Holiday Inn - not that I have anything against Holiday Inn - but if you are paying for a "five-star experience" then please provide it! The nicest person we saw all weekend was the cleaning person who gave us a cheery "Good Morning" as we were making our way to the elevators to leave. Sorry, until I hear about improvements, I will book another property for next year's trip.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations dashed at the Harbor Court”
Reviews.Author: QuincyBaltimore
Reviews.Content: For 11 years, the Harbor Court Hotel located on the Inner Harbor in Baltimore has been a special place for us. We held our wedding reception there and have revisited the hotel a number of times since then for special birthdays, anniversaries, etc. We always considered it our desintation of choice for special getaways. Until this latest trip, we experienced the highest level of quality customer service, decadent meals, and overall satisfaction. Prior to our most recent visit, we were advised by friends that the Harbor Court Hotel is no longer the hotel it once was, following the change in ownership to the Intercontinental, which occurred I believe about a year ago. We were warned not to expect much. Sadly, this turned out to be an accurate statement. We booked an overnight stay to include dinner at Hamptons restaurant. Our dinner was mediocre, with a house salad that was simply greens, and devoid of flavor, a rib eye steak that was average, and filet of sole that was soggy. Although we will give the pastry chef kudos as the creme brulee was divine, and the only bright spot of our stay. We generally will stop in the Explorer's Lounge for cocktails, but had to take a pass this time, as the bar was so full of cigar smoke that it was uncomfortable even walking by, and we overhead another couple walking out for just that reason. Our Harbor View room had a great view, of course, but the clicker on the TV was not reliable, and the thermostat in the room wasn't functioning well so we slept poorly due to the high temperatures. We dared not try anything from the mini bar, as there were many moldy spots inside the fridge. Room service failed miserably. We contacted them in the evening for champagne glasses, only to have them not show up. In our efforts to get ice for the ice bucket, we had to visit another floor, as the one on our floor was not working. We contacted Room Service again the next morning to order breakfast, had to call them back a second time when we realized they didn't ask us for clarification on the side items of our dishes, and were promised a delivery within 35 minutes. After an hour, we called to question whether our breakfast may have left the building. After 75 minutes, the breakfast arrived, cold, without the right number of beverages, and with incorrect side items. Additionally, the mold on the blueberries was the icing on the cake. It is clear that the Intercontinental Harbor Court Hotel is not the hotel we (and many others) know that it used to be. And for the rates charged, it still ought to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadtrips4ever
Reviews.Content: Booked thru priceline.....well worth the money. Staff very friendly & courteous. Across the street from Inner Harbor, close to Fort Mchenry. Upon check in Priceline was never mentioned. I had called hotel after bid accepted and asked for non-smoking king room. Room was large and very nicely appointed. Amenities included the usual soap, shampoo ect.....a bonus was the nice bathrobes! We didn't have a view of the Harbor but rather of the courtyard. The bed was amazing......fluffy feather pillows and feather bed topper.....best nights sleep in a hotel in a long time. Only con, I was surprised we were able to hear noise from another room. We thought probably above us.....it wasn't unbearable just surprising in a luxury hotel. Valet parking very prompt and courteous, but it should be for $29.00 plus tax per night. Can't wait to stay here next time in Baltimore

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlfriends-getaway
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were on a girl's getaway for two days in Baltimore. Got a great last minute rate on Priceline for the Intercontinental Harbor Court. A beautiful hotel, great room amenities, immaculate in every detail. Front desk people were helpful and accommodating, especially Roland, the concierge on duty our first evening in town. Doorman, bellman, all were very efficient. Had a great breakfast in the Brighton. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline users: Pray to get this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rtravels
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here the Saturday before New Year's (Dec. '06) as part of my Christmas present to them. We had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful. Great lobby (the photos on the hotel website are accurate) and the rooms are so nice. Both rooms we stayed in had flat screen tv's in the bathroom, one of the rooms had a HDTV plasma as the main television. The gym is very well done with a large hot tub, indoor pool, sauna, shower faciliites, lockers, a good assorment of machines and even a racquetball court. The hotel is located just across the street from the inner harbor near the science center and is within walking distance of Oriole Park at Camden Yards and whatever- the- name- is- stadium where the Baltimore Ravens play. As for the parking situation...it's true, you'll be charged a few dollars more by the hotel than you would if you just parked in the garage as a non-guest. But there's a reason for this. As a guest, you get in and out priveleges that a person off the street does not. Unless you plan on not moving your car, it's worth it to go with the hotel's rate. Every one of the hotel empolyees we encountered was very nice. The front desk was especially accomodating and professional. They went the extra mile to honor our requests for room type and helped us with a late check out when our morning flight was canceled (even though the hotel was completely booked for the next day and housekeeping probably had its hands full). By the way, we got this hotel on priceline at a great rate. But even the going rate on Intercontinental's website would've been worth it.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental Harbor Court Baltimore
HotelInfo.Address: 550 Light St, Baltimore, MD 21202-6099
